story:
Who are we?

On January 17th myself (Aneesa), Morea, Natalie and Kelsey will be running the HCMC marathon to raise money for the Cau Han Community Development Project - which is one of the HCMC Child Welfare Association's projects!

Who are The Cau Han? 

The Cau Han (who Natalie and I work for) is a community based development project which provides compulsory education to migrant children, poor children, and children from communities affected with HIV/AIDS - children who have NO OTHER MEANS OF ACCESSING EDUCATION.

The Cau Han also provides non formal education, including workshops and training on everything from 'life skills' and 'HIV awareness' to 'Abuse prevention' for the local community. The Cau Han also provides healthcare and access to organisations which provide support for underprivileged people, as well as securing non-exploitative work and training opportunities for young people.

As of May 2021 the Cau Han's funding will end and the children will have no more access to education.  

Where will your donation go?

We are confident that we'll raise enough funding to keep the Cau Han school open, but we need the help of people like yourself! With your donation, we can keep the center open, pay the utilities, provide basic essentials like water and fans, as well as providing the students with essential learning items - books, pens and pencils!

Education is commonly the only thing standing between a happy life, and a life of exploitation and abuse for the Cau Han children, please help us to help them break the cycle of poverty!

How you can help!

If you know us, give us a donation! Anything will do, from a fiver to five hundred, please support us so we can help these young people live better lives!

 

If you're unable to donate on here for any reason but still want to sponsor us, or support this charity, The Cau Han also have a Paypal - hcwa.vn@gmail.com - and can accept bank transfers - go to www.hcwa.org.vn for details <3

story:
Hi. I’m Charlyn Scheffelman, from Billings, MT.

I've been studying permaculture for the past couple of years and am excited and ready to implement this practice of growing organic food that takes very little work.

I took a workshop led by Daniel Halsey, then proceeded to take a course from Goeff Lawton to get my permaculture design degree.  Seeing the value in knowing how permaculture works, my daughter got her design degree from Oregon State University. I am impressed that this method enriches the soil instead of depleting it.

Since I've spent my life teaching a variety of things, including public school, I want to share this knowledge with others. Knowing how to safely and easily grow sustainable food is something I feel strongly about.

I have chosen to initiate this fund as a fixed funding account. This property is turn-key ready to go; all it needs is some cleanup, which I cannot do if I cannot purchase it. Therefore, if I do not reach my goal, your money will automatically be returned to you by Indiegogo.
This campaign only lasts for 60 days! I implore you to spread the word to everyone you know, because this is going to take a crowd! Indiegogo has sharing tools you can use. Contribute if you can, but if you can’t, others you know may be able to help. Sharing this project is as important as contributing!  

Hopefully this campaign will raise the money to buy the land in the pictures as it is the PERFECT place to do just this!

The plan; First Year

  • Once the property has been acquired, water catchment is the first priority. There are compression wells on the property, but there are also several roofs that would catch water to ensure that water is not in short supply through our fall season, which is usually rather dry.

  • Second on my list is a neglected orchard. Dead trees will be replaced and the ones still alive will be restored. Permaculture guilds (plants that help each other) will be installed around these trees,  water-catching swales created, and newly planted fruit trees and bushes will make better use of the land.

  • The large rhubarb bed will be restored, as will the 2 acre kitchen garden area. Both are preexisting.

  • The land that slopes gently toward the house is will accommodate swales, which catch rainwater and funnel it downhill into a pond at the lowest end.

  • There are some solar panels on the hill and on the roof. They would be brought up to date and more would be added. Fortunately, that is my grandson's field.

  •  Sheds will be redesigned to accommodate chickens, some small sheep and other animals.

We hope that this dream becomes a reality, and that YOU come and visit! Thanks so much.

story:
Estudios de Actuación en Argentina 

 

Este año tengo la oportunidad increíble de viajar a la Capital Federal de Buenos Aires, Argentina e ingresar a la Universidad Nacional de las Artes (IUNA). Esta ofrece una Licenciatura de Actuación de unos cinco años. 

En esos años también voy a estar solicitando para la Escuela Metropolitana de Artes Dramaticas en donde puedo hacer mi Certificación en Teatro Callejero en dos años. 

Adicional a esto con la Escuela Cachimba especializando en la Técnica Lecoq y en Clown.

Todas estas metas se estan cumpliendo y estoy muy emocionada por ello pero necesito su ayuda. 

Esta campaña es para cualquier tipo de donativo y apoyo que deseen otorgarme. Cualquier cosa vale la pena, hasta compartir esta campaña. Gracias de antemano y les aseguro que no será en vano. Tengo muchísimas pasiones y esta campaña es para lograr cada una de ellas. 

Más que dinero, espero sus vibras positivas. 

 

Adjunto un poco de lo que trabaje en solo dos semanas de visita allá (Julio 2018).

story:
Hi everyone, my name is Salma Ali. I am a fresh graduate from the faculty of science – Alexandria University finished a major in geophysics and a minor in geology. I have been always seeking to study pure physics, suffering a lot in applying for scholarships and trying to qualify myself with every requirement guaranteed me a place in one of them. NOW I am enraptured to announce that I have been privileged with the opportunity to travel to England starting a course-in-clearing, full-time physics.
I have applied for 5 Universities through UCAS.com and got accepted in three of them with two unconditional and one conditional offer. I have chosen to study at Sheffield Hallam University then directly applied for the Transform Together scholarship which allows me to have a 50% discount on my tuitions fees each year, and I was honoured to be one of the winners for this year. With this being said, there are several costs associated with living and studying there. I am managing to work during my stay, but there are still the costs of my first year needed to be accounted for in order for me to pursue this opportunity while I am working for the next year. My course will begin in September. Below, you will find specifics in regards to the details of costs. Whether you are able to assist or not, I am very appreciative of your continual love and support!

 

Costs:

 

_ Travel costs: £500( this include the international airfare and train cost from Manchester to Sheffield )
_ Visa for England: £600
_ University fees per year: £13,000 (for international students, it becomes £6,500 after the scholarship)
_  Accommodation: £250 per month
_ Overall living costs per month (including accommodation): £500

those turn out to be: £13,800

converting to American dollar: $18,300

 

Again, I am very grateful for you taking the time to view this. If you have any further questions, please feel free to reach out to me.

 

Email: sci.salmaali.2015@alexu.edu.eg
 

 With Regards,
 

Salma Ali

story:
REMARK: The video was made a couple of years ago when I was applying for a teaching position in Kyrgyzstan (which I got and taught there for 5-6 months).  

About
Hello, thanks for visiting this campaign. I’m Alissa, an ordinary full-time recruiter at a start-up and part-time English teacher in Thailand whose dream is to open “English Only!” an English language school in Samutprakan province (next to Bangkok).  I have been teaching for about 5 years now:
 - 2 years in Thailand at a language school (mostly children, 4 skills, grammar & phonics)
- 1 year in Laos to teens & grown ups (IELTS speaking) 
- 6 months in Kyrgyzstan (young teens & grown ups, conversation) 
- Almost 1 year online till date (conversation: day to day, business English, presentation & interview)
I have taken the IELTS in 2011 with an overall band of 7 (8.5 in speaking). 
 I also have a teaching certificate (TESOL) which adds to my expertise in teaching and have been invited to teach corporate English for managerial staff at a company. 

Below: Taught English at a language school in Thailand. 

Below: Taught English with activities (on this photo, making origami) at a local government school in Thailand.

Below: Taught IELTS speaking at a language school in Laos.

Below: Taught English conversation at a language school in Kyrgyzstan.

Below: Taught Corporate English with senior staff (managers, directors) at a company in Thailand.

The Problem
Despite having learned English since grade 1 and taking extra classes during the weekend, the majority of Thai students still lack understanding and fluency in English. Worst of all, they are still shy and afraid to speak English. 
According to EF in 2017, Thailand ranks 53rd out of 80 nations in terms of English proficiency which is “low”.  https://www.ef.co.th/epi/regions/asia/thailand/ 
Why are students unable to speak with so many years of learning? -> They learn the reverse: grammar first. 

The Inspiration:
As someone who calls Thailand her home having been here for over 10 years, I got inspired by my international experience especially in Kyrgyzstan to open up my own language school with a completely new approach in teaching: 

  •     No text books! -> Student's won't have to spend extra money on textbooks nor carry them along to every class (as there's none). We mainly use PowerPoint presentations and sometimes other means (realia, videos, songs, illustrations, photos, etc.).
  •     No boring grammar lessons -> Students will learn mental grammar (just how toddlers learn to speak before entering kindergarten)
  •     No sitting down/falling asleep throughout the class -> Lots of fun and engaging group activities and games in English
  •     No typical day to day talks only -> Students will learn idioms & quotes on top of general conversations.
  • Every student gets the chance to talk/say something in English. In fact, everyone will be asked to at least say something in English in class. No exceptions especially with a class size of maximum 12.
  • No chronology in courses. Courses are separated by levels and age groups (13+ and below 13). Flexible enrollment where students can join classes anytime without having missed prerequisites because there's none. Those who feel ready to move up the level simply inform the teacher and will take an oral test at their convenient times. 
  • Soft skills on top of English (students will do presentations, debates, singing, negotiations, constructive feedback providing and acting) which can be applied in real life professions. 
  • Classroom environment: home-like, no shoes in class, bean bags & chairs, no tables, lots of empty space for fun activities.
  • Young, active teachers from different countries with excellent English (not only native English-speakers, we value and promote diversity!). 
  • NO Non-English language within the school area to be spoken or else, the student will be fined 5 Baht per word which goes to their FREE coffee & tea and this rule explains the name of “English Only!”. The only place Thai/non-English is allowed to be spoken is at the reception (Q&A with the receptionist).
  • Social space: there will be space for socialising in English with a table for tea break, doing homework or playing board games. 

 The “no non-English” rule sounds harsh, but it has been implemented at the language school I taught in Kyrgyzstan and works like a charm! 

Courses offered: 
We focus on speaking & listening mainly so all group classes will be based on those 2 skills. For reading & writing, it is encouraged for students to take notes from the presentation by the teachers. 
Private classes are also offered but that will be more of a tutoring style and flexible (according to student's immediate needs) such as preparing for a language proficiency exam like IELTS/TOEFL namely or if they need help with their homework or simply would like to to converse one on one. 

What We Need & What You Get
Ideas, plans and expertise are there. Only the budget is missing. Despite working full-time and part-time, I only get paid so much to cover my rent, utilities, food, transport and very occasional leisure activities.  Taking a loan from the bank or getting venture capitalists to invest are secondary options. I plan to bootstrap my language school where I use minimal resources to run it until it is self-sustainable and I can invest more from what I have self-generated. This means I will be responsible for being both the receptionist (my mother will help me along the way) and the teacher. 

The start-up cost will roughly cost at least 600,000 Baht (about $20,000) and monthly operational costs will cost about 150,000 (about $5000) Baht. As the first one is a minimum cost, I would like to raise up to $10,000 and the rest will be funded from personal budget or other sources of finance. 

What’s in start-up cost? Few things to name:  
- Machines (printer, computer, projectors, laptop, etc.) 
- Furniture (chairs, tables, beanbags, desks, shelves, etc.) 
- Renovation (wall painting, flooring, front entrance installment, etc.)
- Long-term marketing materials (Signs, roll-up banners, etc.) 

What’s in monthly operational cost? Few things to name: 
- Rent (this costs 25,000 Baht or about $800)
- Utilities (electricity, Internet, water) 
- Salaries (though I plan to be both receptionist and teacher at first with mom’s help, eventually I have to hire someone as we can’t multitask) 
- Tax (this is annual but we include that in monthly breakdown) 

If the fund goal is not reached, I will have to keep them to invest in start-up costs like furniture, equipment, etc. To cover other expenses I will have to get loans. This will also mean that opening the school may be delayed by several months.

How to ensure the business runs? 
- Clear target markets. Primary target: parents who send kids to learn. Secondary market: teenagers and first jobbers who either want to study abroad or make a better career move.
- Class size: I will make sure the class does not exceed 12 students so that everyone gets a chance to speak. This is also a good number when playing activities/games as teams.
- Strategic location: I plan to open the school next to the skytrain station so people both from Samutprakan province (which is a heavily residential area) and Bangkok can easily commute.
- I’ve done market research with data where I can adjust some of the market needs in the business (e.g. pricing, curriculum, ,marketing channels, etc.) 
- I already have a pool of satisfied students who can help with promoting the school as testimonials
- Marketing though social media (Facebook, Instagram, Youtube, LinkedIn) 
- Offline marketing: exhibiting education fairs, word of mouth, testimonials, etc. (we can’t invest too much in offline marketing at this point) 
- Staff training (both teachers and receptionists) to ensure high quality service is delivered 
- Clear positioning and we are at a less competitive position than competitors as we have different teaching methods. 
- Vast options of hours. As I plan to rent a whole building, not a unit in a shopping mall, I will be able to open classes as early as 7:30am until as late as 10pm. 

The Impact

  • Students have higher chances to study abroad 
  • Our students who are employees may receive promotions/assigned for business trips/etc. 
  • Travel lovers won't need guides and can freely travel abroad
  • More job opportunities for students and those seeking part-time jobs 
  • More internship opportunities for university students (I will open internship opportunities for interns throughout the year) as the staff work in shifts
  • United Nations Development Program's Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) #4 "Quality Education" contributed

Timeline:
Raising funds will take time. Lots of time. In July I have to pay for my final tuition fee for my master's (this is not included in the budget for this campaign, it's purely personal budget). October will be my final month of studies.
Oct-Dec will be establishing the language school including renovating & decorating the facility, shopping for equipment & furniture, recruiting & training the team and heaps of marketing! 
January 2019 is expected to be the month where we open doors to the public. 

***REMARK: This is only for the case where the crowdfunding goal has been met. If it has not been met, the opening of the school will be delayed by several months.***

Risks & Challenges
We did a SWOT analysis as well and in terms of weaknesses and threats we have: 
* Weaknesses: low budget, weak infrastructure, unfamiliar method to the market
* Threats: competition, copycats (though this is a good problem in terms of getting more people to learn English in a fun way but a bad problem in terms of business)
* Plans to fight the challenge:   
-> Receive more funds (investments/loans) to invest into the business.
-> Quality delivery, we will ensure students learn and have fun. We focus on their learning based on how much they (dare) to speak. A recording of an interview will be done before they start the course and after learning for a consistent amount of 30-45 days (depending on the frequency) we host another interview recording to check progress. 
-> Competitive price: ensuring that courses have flexible options for different purchasing powers yet still sustainable to the business. 
-> If possible and if our business grows fast, we hope to expand into Bangkok also. 
-> Showcase that we're the first in Thailand to be using this method. 

How else you can contribute: 
If finance is not a way for you to contribute, I'd highly appreciate if the post can be shared. Many out there love Thailand for what it offers especially in tourism, but it's also the people. I can almost guarantee that if you have been to Thailand, you have faced language barriers. This is why we are here. :-) 

THANK YOU SO MUCH! <3 
Lisa

This is also a good number when playing activities/games as teams.- Strategic location: I plan to open the school next to the skytrain station so people both from Samutprakan province (which is a heavily residential area) and Bangkok can easily commute.- I’ve done market research with data where I can adjust some of the market needs in the business (e.g. pricing, curriculum, ,marketing channels, etc.) - I already have a pool of satisfied students who can help with promoting the school as testimonials- Marketing though social media (Facebook, Instagram, Youtube, LinkedIn) - Offline marketing: exhibiting education fairs, word of mouth, testimonials, etc. (we can’t invest too much in offline marketing at this point) - Staff training (both teachers and receptionists) to ensure high quality service is delivered - Clear positioning and we are at a less competitive position than competitors as we have different teaching methods. - Vast options of hours. As I plan to rent a whole building, not a unit in a shopping mall, I will be able to open classes as early as 7:30am until as late as 10pm. The Impact
Students have higher chances to study abroad 
Our students who are employees may receive promotions/assigned for business trips/etc. 
Travel lovers won't need guides and can freely travel abroad
More job opportunities for students and those seeking part-time jobs 
More internship opportunities for university students (I will open internship opportunities for interns throughout the year) as the staff work in shifts
United Nations Development Program's Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) #4 "Quality Education" contributed
Timeline:Raising funds will take time. Lots of time. In July I have to pay for my final tuition fee for my master's (this is not included in the budget for this campaign, it's purely personal budget). October will be my final month of studies.Oct-Dec will be establishing the language school including renovating & decorating the facility, shopping for equipment & furniture, recruiting & training the team and heaps of marketing! January 2019 is expected to be the month where we open doors to the public. ***REMARK: This is only for the case where the crowdfunding goal has been met. If it has not been met, the opening of the school will be delayed by several months.***Risks & ChallengesWe did a SWOT analysis as well and in terms of weaknesses and threats we have: * Weaknesses: low budget, weak infrastructure, unfamiliar method to the market* Threats: competition, copycats (though this is a good problem in terms of getting more people to learn English in a fun way but a bad problem in terms of business)* Plans to fight the challenge:   -> Receive more funds (investments/loans) to invest into the business.-> Quality delivery, we will ensure students learn and have fun. We focus on their learning based on how much they (dare) to speak. A recording of an interview will be done before they start the course and after learning for a consistent amount of 30-45 days (depending on the frequency) we host another interview recording to check progress. -> Competitive price: ensuring that courses have flexible options for different purchasing powers yet still sustainable to the business. -> If possible and if our business grows fast, we hope to expand into Bangkok also. -> Showcase that we're the first in Thailand to be using this method. How else you can contribute: If finance is not a way for you to contribute, I'd highly appreciate if the post can be shared. Many out there love Thailand for what it offers especially in tourism, but it's also the people. I can almost guarantee that if you have been to Thailand, you have faced language barriers. This is why we are here. :-) THANK YOU SO MUCH! <3 Lisa

story:
Who I am?

I am a Bolivia teenager with a great passion for drawing and photography, I studied 3 years of gastronomy  and I worked in different restaurants / cafeterias, very late I realized that this race was not the best option in my city, yyou do not earn well being a chef, could not get my family out of poverty.

there is not a professional photographer career where I live

I want to give hope to my family, to be able to tell my niece in a few years that she can come to the country where I work, to visit me or if she is looking to study there, there would be no words to describe my happiness and gratitude

Why support me?

During the last 2 years I have tried in every possible way to save on my own to pay for my studies, but it is really impossible for me, the minimum wage in La Paz-Bolivia is 250 dollars per month, I also have to pay for my transportation, food and bills, it is difficult to save, we have a small family restaurant with which we survive.

How will your support change the course of my life?

I am very excited to study, learn and work on what I am good at and most like, but the best thing is to be able to help my mother, who gave me everything and raised me alone. When I graduate, I can change the future of my family and give to my mother all she deserves.

A little push

I need your help to pay my professional photographer career fees in Motivate in Argentina plus travel and visa expenses, I need to secure $ 10,000 to study and live in Argentina.

Where will I invest the funds?

$ 4,500 career and postgraduate
$ 1,000 visa and travel procedures
$ 4,500 Accommodation

Any contribution is very important and will bring me closer and closer to my dream, thank you very much for reading my case, you can also share it or show it to someone 

Postscript: I am someone very grateful, I am sure I will return to this page, and this time I will be on the side that will contribute to others.

 

please, contact me for any questions (dorodarake19.4@gmail.com)

story:
We are a group of Oxford graduates working in the tech industry. As passionate technologists, we all agree that coding has shaped our future. Since 2017, we have been working towards our goal of initiating a fun way for kids aged 8 - 15 to learn Python. We are now proudly introducing the "When Python Meets micro:bit" Learning Set and the "micro:bit Explorer Kit".

Python is an incredible programming language recommended by top-notched developers. Have you ever thought of letting your children start learning Python, the very important programming language used by tech giants and start-ups?

Although Python is a widely-used programming language, self-learning Python could be sometimes challenging. Therefore, as passionate technologists, we have created the “When Python Meets micro:bit" Learning Set to make the learning easy and interesting.  It's perfect for beginners. Everyone can learn Python easily with us. You will also receive technical support by us if you have any difficulty.

Let the coding journey begin!

story:
Do you know what it is like when you receive academic material, which is hard to interpret and use?

Everyone has had that experience.

This is where we come in.

Our mission is to make hard, dense and opaque material easier to understand and assimilate.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Le français suit

Do you like to participate in singing contests? Do you see yourself singing on television? Do you find yourself breaking out in song at your friends' parties or at karaoke bars? Are you more of a private singer, delivering your favourite tunes in your living room or in the shower?

No matter where or why you sing, virtual voice coaching might just be what you need to bring your vocal skills to a higher level. After more than 50 years of singing, teaching and research, Montreal voice teacher Philippe Parent has teamed up with Wizgo to create a virtual voice application that you can download to Apple Store and Google Play.

This multimedia tool will include video clips and a multitude of information for anyone who wants to master the art of singing. It will also be useful for amateur singers who wish to participate in singing contests anywhere in the world by simplifying basic technical voice teaching. That's right: you will be able to practice voice techniques thanks to this innovative software. No matter where you are, whether at home, on vacation, or even walking on a sidewalk, the singer in you will be able to apply vocal exercises sent directly to your iPad or smart phone.

Philippe Parent, voice teacher since the 1960's, author of vocal 
techniques' book  LA VOIX AU PRÉSENT, creator of the concept of the 
Virtual Coach - Learn to sing application.

A fan from Turkey


Software

This multimedia application will be available on IOS (iPhone, iPad, iPod Touch) and Android 4.0. The application was created to offer a smooth navigation for various content. More than 40 HD full-screen video exercises are available, showing the position of the body, the head and the neck. Users can always replay the video to get a better understanding of the exercise.

The main features of the application:

  • You can use it offline
  • Content is updated automatically
  • Exercises are explained in HD video
  • Easy-to-use summary for the selection of content
  • Technical illustrations and animation

Timeline

Where will your money go?

5% will go to Indiegogo

5% will go to PayPal

20% to the Software

40% filming videoclips

30% will go to the development and production team's salaries

Our campaign goals

$ 30 000 CAD will allow us to create an app for iPhone/iOS (January2016) and Android  phones as well (January 2016)

$ 40 000 CAD can significantly speed up our development and production process

The greater goal we achieve, the greater the possibilities.

With your help we can guarantee the continuous development of our app.

Company Background

Founded in 2001, Wizgo inc. is a producer of interactive multimedia content for the mobile platform and the Internet. In addition, Wizvox designs, develops and integrates communications and e-commerce tools for business customers (SMEs).

The partners have acquired over the years, experience in creation in multiplatform production in the New Information Technologies (NTI) and scientific content. Moreover, Wizgo has assembled a team of professionals capable of maintaining this delicate balance between creativity and technology and market requirements.

Marc-André St-Laurent, Cofounder & Director

Daniel Madore, Cofounder & Producer

Anne-Marie Parent, Researcher

Please click and share our campaign with your friends and family on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media, and let the world know about our virtual trainer's voice. Your support and encouragement are greatly appreciated!


FAQ

Q. : What phones are supported?

A. :  iPhone 4S/5/5C/5S/6/6+ and later

iPad 3/4/Air and later

iPad Mini 1/2 and later

Android 4.0 and later devices

(We have tested the Samsung Galaxy Line)

Q. : Do you support Windows phones?

A. :Unfortunately, we don't support Windows phones.

Q. : Do you support Blackberry phones?

A. : Some Blackberry phones support Android apps, but we have not tested if our apps  Keep an eye out on our website to see the compatibility is confirmed.

Q. : Do you have more questions?

A. : Don't hesitate to email us at info@wizgo.ca (in english and in french). We'll get back to you as soon as possible.

We promise that this project will be worth the wait. Thank you for believing in us!


 

Vous voulez chanter?... dans des concours?… à la télévision?... chez des amis, dans votre salon ou sous la douche? Peu importe la raison, le coach de voix virtuel est pour vous. Après plus de 50 ans de recherche, de pratique et d’expérience, le professeur de chant montréalais Philippe Parent s’associe à l'entreprise Wizgo pour créer une application de coach de voix virtuel à télécharger dans l'Apple Store et le Google Play.


Cet outil multimédia comprendra plusieurs clips vidéos et une multitude d’information pour ceux et celles qui désirent maitriser l’art du chant. Il servira aussi aux amateurs qui désirent participer à des concours de chant partout au monde, en facilitant l’apprentissage des techniques vocales. En effet, vous pourrez faire des exercices de chant grâce à ce logiciel très novateur. Où que vous vous trouviez, à la maison, en voyage, en marchant sur le trottoir, l’artiste en herbe en vous pourra mettre en pratique les activités vocales qui sont proposées à distance, grâce à votre tablette électronique ou votre téléphone intelligent.

Une «fan» de Turquie

Logiciel

Cette application multimédia sera disponible sur iOS (iPhone, iPad, iPod Touch) et Android 4.0. L'application a été créée pour offrir une navigation fluide pour divers contenus. Plus de 40 vidéo HD plein écran exercices sont disponibles, montrant la position du corps, la tête et le cou. Les utilisateurs peuvent toujours rejouer la vidéo pour obtenir une meilleure compréhension de l'exercice.

Les principales fonctionnalités de l'application:
• Vous pouvez l'utiliser en mode hors connexion
• Le contenu est automatiquement mis à jour
• Les exercices sont expliqués dans la vidéo HD

• Facile à utiliser pour la sélection de contenu
• Les illustrations techniques et d'animation

Échéancier de la campagne

Où va votre argent?

5% iront à Indiegogo

5% iront à PayPal

20% au logiciel

40% au tournage des vidéos clips

30% iront aux salaires de l'équipe de développement et de production

Nos objectifs de la campagne
30 000 $ CAD vont nous permettre de créer une application pour iPhone / iOS (janvier 2016) et les téléphones Android aussi (janvier 2016).

40 000 $ CAD pourraient considérablement accélérer notre processus de développement et de production.

Plus nous dépasserons nos objectifs, les plus grandes sont les possibilités.

Avec votre aide, nous pouvons garantir le développement continu de notre application

La compagnie

Fondée en 2001, Wizgo inc. est un producteur de contenus multimédias interactifs pour l’Internet mobile et multiplateforme. De plus, il conçoit, développe et intègre des outils de communications et de commerce électronique pour des entreprises clientes (PME).

Ses principaux actionnaires ont acquis, au fil des ans, une expérience en création, en production multiplateforme dans les Nouvelles Technologies de l’Information (NTI) et en vulgarisation scientifique. De plus, Wizgo s’est entouré d’une équipe de professionnels apte à maintenir ce fragile équilibre entre créativité et technologie et les besoins du marché.

Marc-André St-Laurent, cofondateur & réalisateur

Daniel Madore, cofondateur & producteur

Anne-Marie Parent, Recherchiste

Autres façons de nous aider:

S'il vous plaît cliquez et partagez notre campagne avec vos amis et votre famille sur Facebook, Twitter et autres médias sociaux, afin que le monde soit au courant de la création de notre coach virtuel de la voix. Votre soutien et vos encouragements sont grandement appréciés!

FAQ

Q. : Quels téléphones et tablettes peuvent être utilisés?

R. :  iPhone 4S/5/5C/5S/6/6+ et dernière version

iPad 3/4/Air et dernière version

iPad Mini 1/2 et dernière version

Android 4.0 and et dernière version

(Nous avons testé la ligne SamsungGalaxy)

Q. : Avez-vous testé les téléphones Windows ?

R. : Malheureusement, les téléphones Windows ne sont pas adaptés pour notre application.

Q. : Êtes-vous favorable auxtéléphones Blackberry?

R. : Certains téléphones Blackberry supportent les applications Android, mais nous ne l’avons pas testé sur notre application. Gardez un oeil sur notre site pour voir si la compatibilité est confirmée.

Q. : Avez-vous d'autres questions?
R. : N’hésitez pas à nous contacter à info@wizgo.ca (en français et en anglais). Nous vous reviendrons dès que possible.

Nous vous promettons que ce projet vaut la peine d'attendre. Merci de croire en nous!

R. : N’hésitez pas à nous contacter à info@wizgo.ca (en français et en anglais). Nous
vous reviendrons dès que possible.
Nous vous promettons que ce
projet vaut la peine d'attendre. Merci de croire en nous!

story:
Introduction

I want to establish an ICT Training facility (like the picture above) for youths, women and individuals within and outside the state; to help bridge the digital divide between them and open doors to many under-served youths in my state and beyond.

The Training Centre’s immediate benefit shall focus on the creation of a better business competitiveness, jobs creation, investment opportunities, infrastructural improvements, academic enhancement, global inclusion and participation within the information society process. The following shall be the main objective of the (proposed) ICT Training Centre:

  • To bridge the digital divide and open doors to many underserved youths of the state and beyond.
  • Attaining height in the standard of education for Technology and the creation of new job opportunities and market oriented values using ICT.
  • Development of a virtual library that provides information and answers urgent questions that meets real economic benefits, impact and social and gender inclusion.
  • Improving quality of life and creating new opportunities for others who otherwise may not have had the opportunity.


How Funds Will Be Used

The funds gathered from this campaign shall be used for:

  • Purchase of plots of land
  • Building construction to accommodate the facilities for this projects
  • Purchase of Computer Systems, Workstation desks, servers, network cables.
  • Other equipment necessary to set up an ICT Training Centre
  • Purchase of training materials and bills.
The Training Centre shall be used to conduct Computer-Based Tests for:
  • Joint Admissions & Matriculation Board (JAMB)
  • West African Examination Council (WAEC)
  • National Examination Council (NECO)
  • Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL)
  • International English Language Testing System (IELTS)
  • Educational Testing Service (ETS)
  • Graduate Record Examination (GRE)
  • SAT (formerly known as Scholastic Aptitude Test, SAT Reasoning Test, etc.)
Profits shall be generated from these examination bodies who would use the centre to conduct their examination biannually, annually or as the case may be. Income realized from these events shall be used in maintaining and upgrading the centre and its facilities, and would also be used in encouraging youths for micro-business startups.

The Impact

The project shall be a Model for other New Millennium ICTs project. It shall enhance the way people and organizations communicate, exchange knowledge and access information. The centre shall facilitate the development of:

  • Entrepreneurship and youth leadership development.
  • A unifying focus for all tribes, race without discrimination.
  • A centre that provide a world class and unique socio-economic, political and Technological development.
  • The project shall be a convergence of opportunity for moving people and ideas that maintains a high quality of life and sustainable development.


Risks/Challenges & Solutions

Since the centre is basically focused on accommodating candidates sitting for Computer-Based Testing (examination), the major challenge here is power in this part of the world. I am going to run an exam for two or three weeks and it must be run on diesel or petrol, which seems to be the cheapest, though technologically, solar energy would be more cheaper than running diesel or petrol in the generator.

Another challenge, especially when starting this centre, is getting a place big enough to accommodate whatever I want to do. I need a big place (land) with ample space for parking lot and a holding area because of large crowd where the next batch of candidates can stay before their turn.

Yet another challenge is the integrity of the personnel, which I must ascertain. The staff must not compromise. The person in charge of testing the server must be someone of impeccable integrity.

Solutions:

If the software is porous or he's someone who can hack into my database, or who might want to check the results and to change some; there will be problem which will dent the image of the centre. Even if the software person doesn't compromise, another member of staff might do and promise the candidates that they will manipulate for them, which they won't be able to do, but they would have tainted my name and centre. So, I have to be sure of the people I are employing.

In CBT, the chances of exam malpractice are minimal and can be traced unlike in Paper & Pencil Testing (PPT). Also, if there is leakage of the exam, the paper can be cancelled immediately and I have another one written. So, if I assign someone trustworthy in place, I won't have anything to worry about.


Other Ways You Can Help:

You can help us spread the word by sharing our Link. Please share this campaign!

story:
Update (8/26/2015) Hardware and Software needed for Project/Experiment





Update (08/25/2015)  Purchase and Test E-mail Ultimate Goal

In the movie Terminator Genisys,  Genisys is a software that has AI . Access is available through desktop and mobile devices. It is the ultimate goal of my project for an individual to send email back email to oneself using Goupwise  https://www.novell.com/products/groupwise/ . You will access Groupwise  through desktop or mobile device and compose email with information(events). The information in the email will be accelerated faster than the change in space time into the future and back in time to be received in the present. Like Terminator Genisys, I want to create a company that has a warehouse of servers or with my hardware and software configurations that will allow users to send information(events) back in time to themselves to manipulate their future. But the difference between Genisys and Groupwise is that Groupwise is not self-aware(No AI). The user will make the decision. Groupwise  will also be tied into a server with newsfeed or open source information (events) accelerates email with information (events) faster than change in space time into the future back in time received in the present. Everybody connected to Groupwise on their desktop and mobile device receives an email (early warning of event that will happen). Messages will also be sent to NORAD and the Situation Room. Response based on message can be to acted upon autonomously, semi-autonomously or decision made and responded by humans. But the first step is to fund my email project or project to purchase e-mail server and test it. With your help,  I will do it.



Groupwise is like Genisys (Except no AI, only generates email info which contains events or email generated by the user. Email accelerates faster than the Earth's change in space time into the future back in time to be received in the present).


GROUP WISE WILL NOTIFY NORAD (EMAIL WILL SERVE AS EARLY WARNING SYSTEM, RESPONSE CAN BE AUTONOMOUS, SEMI-AUTONOMOUS OR RESPONSE CAN BE INITIATED BY HUMANS)


GROUPWISE WILL NOTIFY SITUATION ROOM ON EVENTS AND ALLOW FOR THE US GOVERNMENT TO MANIPULATE THE FUTURE OF THE US IN THE BEST INTEREST OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.


Help support my other project too.

http://igg.me/at/deaddropservice



Update (8/24/2015)

Hollow Core Band Gap Fiber Optic Experiment Updated(Technical or more advanced).

1. Small message 1 KB  (which also contracts  more as it nears the speed of light).

2. Travel through hollow core band gap fiber optic cable (97% speed of light and time slows down as it nears the speed of light which allows it to cover more distance).

3. The distance covered is .1 meter which is done in .000,000,000,333,564,1 seconds=.1m/299,792,458 m/s2 or .2 meter .000,000,000,667,128,19 seconds = .2 meter / 299,792,458 m/s 2.

4. All together the small message contracts and  slows as it nears the speed of light which allows it to cover more distance as time slows but in this experiment the distance has been shortened to .1 meter or .2 meter.

5. If speed of light is constant, and time slows down as message nears speed of light which allows it to cover more distance but the distance to cover in the experiment is .1 meter or .2 meter (very short) and going near or at the speed of light also causes the small message to contract, what will happen in the experiment to the message with respect to Relativity and Special Relativity? With respect to space time with space on one axis and time on the other axis, the message will be near 97% the speed of light in the hollow core band gap fiber optic cable and with very little space to cover .1 meter .2 meter. Even though the time it takes to cover the distance of .1 m and .2 m is .000,000,000,3 seconds and  .000,000,000,6 seconds, the fact is that the time slowdown and allow the email message that is going near or at the speed of light to cover more distance.

6. If the speed of light is constant and the distance is short (.1 or .2) and time slows which allows more distance to be covered, then 1) the email will arrive in a shorter time since distance is shorter but it does not add up when Time = Distance/ Velocity. If Velocity is 299,72,458 according to Relativity but distance is . 1 m or .2 meters but  although tie equals .000,000,000,3 seconds or .000,000,000,6 seconds  but Special relativity says that time slows for anything that goes near or at the speed of light so the messages time will slow down yet respect Relativity(299,792,458 m/s 2).

7.The message going 299,792,458 m/s 2 time slows down so it covers .1 m in .000,000,000,3 seconds. If speed of light is constant and so is the distance but it shrinks (.1 or .2 shrinks) for the formula T=D/V to remain constant or true then the time must shrink. If the time and distance shrink  then the email message will be closer to the axis of speed of light with little or no space to cover.

8. If time is slowed or close to 0 because the message is traveling at or near the speed of light if the distance is very short (shrunk), can the message travel at the speed of light through the short distance(shrunk) before time moves forward? That is the question of the Experiment. The email is sent through the fiber optic cable form ricardo.gil@sbcglobal.net to ricardo.gil@sbcglobal.net. The email is going 97% of the seed of light through the hollow core fiber optic cable. Time slows allowing the message to cover more distance but the distance is short .1 m or .2m. It is like a Worm Hole. Except replace surface with time. A TIME WORM HOLE.

9.The impossibility of faster-than-light relative speed only applies locally. Wormholes might allow superluminal (faster-than-light) travel by ensuring that the speed of light is not exceeded locally at any time. While traveling through a wormhole, subluminal (slower-than-light) speeds are used. If two points are connected by a wormhole whose length is shorter than the distance between them outside the wormhole, the time taken to traverse it could be less than the time it would take a light beam to make the journey if it took a path through the space outside the wormhole. However, a light beam traveling through the wormhole would of course beat the traveler.

10. In a Time Worm Hole the time slows down for the email message and the distance is .1 or .2 m which shrinks because the message is near or at the speed of light. The time it takes for the message to be transmitted to self is a lot faster than the time it take for the earth to move in space time even if its not F-T-L.The parallel between the worm hole and the time worm hole is that the worm hole has a shortcut that is space. And the Time Worm Hole is that email sent to self at or near the speed of light  is faster than change in space time of the Earth. The shortcut in Time Worm Hole is time, the time it takes for the email to be sent to self with information is faster (299,792,458 m/s2 ) than the time for the earth to change in space time (30,463 m/s2 ). With respect to Relativity one adds (299,792,458 m/s2 ) and (30,463 m/s2 ) them together  the speed of the email, so the email is going faster than light. (Computer on earth sends email to self).

11. Whether with the fiber optic hollow core band gap version experiment or the CRAY XC 40, theoretically it should work.

12. Can't sent a Terminator back in time to defeat Skynet right now, but, one could send an email back to change events.


Update (8/22/2015)



In my projects the goal is to shorten the distance of the email while it is going near the speed of light or at the speed of light. As a result time slows down(Special Relativity). Speed of light is constant but TIME slows down and allows for greater distance to be covered. What will happen if I reduce the distance of the message? If one has the formula time = distance/ velocity then or if velocity is constant speed of light, and distance is .4 m (small distance) and time slows down then the time should also be short at the same time.  (T= .000,000,001 seconds=.4m/299,792,458  m/s 2.)

I am attempting to 2 experiments;

1. With fiber optic cable(see gallery)
2. Supercomputer with a lot of processors(see gallery).

In the test with the fiber optic cable, the peed of light will be 189,000,000 m/s up to  290,798,684 m/s 2. So according to Special relativity the time should slow down as it nears the message reaches near the speed of light.

In the test with the supercomputer(see gallery), theoretically the distance the email will go is very small and will be computed at a speed equivalent to 3,072,056,135 m/s2. (theoretically much faster than the speed of light).

Either way the message theoretically will go back or near to going back in time with the fiber optic experiment or in the the Cray experiment, it will actually go back in time.

MY THEORY OR HYPOTHESIS

In both experiments the message will being going near the speed of light or in the Cray experiment, theoretically much faster. The change in space time of the Earth is 30,463 m/s 2 (rotation of Earth on its axis and Earths orbit around Sun). In the Video, the truck was going 50 mph and the ball tossed between the two kids was 10 mph. But the speed of the ball is 60 mph. Now in my experiments the Earth is moving at 30,463 m/s 2 and the message will be going from 189,000,000 up to 290,798,684 m/s 2  in the fiber optic experiments and in the Cray experiment the email will theoretically will be going 3,072,056,135 m/s2. But if you add the speed of the Earth to both experiments, then the speed of the message will be 297,829,147 m/s 2 ( Near the speed of light/ time slows down)in the fiber optic experiments and in the Cray experiment the message will theoretically be going 3,072,056,598 m/s2. (Faster than the speed of light/ Time goes back)

I can only test my experiments if you help fund my project. If not share on Facebook or Tweet your Friends. A share on Facebook or Tweet is good as $.


Short Summary

E-MAIL SERVER'S objective is to test email that violates causality(cause and effect) in which  the time it takes for the message to travel equals to that of a message that goes faster than light (send email back in time). I am aware that nothing can travel faster than the speed of light. But the hardware and software configuration will allow for a message to be tested and document if the time is equal to that of a message that goes faster than the speed of light or violates causality. (equal to or faster than the speed of light and the email will go back in time).


Experiment Explained (Technical yet Simple) Fiber Optic Experiment

My hardware and software configuration will allow for a message to be tested to document if the time is equal to that of a message that goes faster than the speed of light or violates causality (goes back in time).  This is done by manipulating the configuration (Length of Pathway of Email Message).

Using the simple formula Time= Distance/ Velocity the time for a message traveling at the speed of light would be

1m (email pathway)

___________________    = .000,000,003 seconds

299,792,458 m/s2(speed of light)


To go faster than the speed of light (in theory)

.4 m (email pathway)

___________________  = .000,000,002 seconds 

*199,861,638 m/s2.

*(Speed of light in the cable which is refracted is less than 299,792,458 m/s 2 ). Since the pathway is shorter and the time equals .000,000,002 the speed of the message with pathway of .4m with velocity or speed of 199,861,638 m/s 2 would be .000,000,002 seconds. It would equal the time of an email with pathway of 1 meter going in theory 499,654,095 m/s 2 (faster than light/goes back in time).

1m (email pathway)          499,654,095 m/s2 (faster than speed of light)

___________________  = _______________________

.4 m (email pathway)        199,861,638 m/s2


Worst case scenario for the experiment with my configuration hardware and software configuration is that if it does not go faster than light and back in time, the email will be very fast. The email server with my hardware and software configuration will become a email accelerator.

Experiment Explained (Technical more advanced) Cray Exeperiment

Internal Email

I was talking to a Novell Groupwise Software Engineer and he told me that the pathway of an email sent to self (ricardo.gil@sbcglobal.net to ricardo.gil@sbcglobal.net) would be internal. So I calculated the speed of an internal email. It turns out that a Xeon 5 at 3.0 gigahertz will equal 3.3333333333333 E-10 seconds or .000,000,000,333,333,333,333,33 seconds to send/receive email. Given T=D/V, if the distance were 1 m/299,792,458 m/s2 the time would equal to 3.33564095E-9 seconds or .000,000,003,335,640,95 seconds (speed of light). Since the pathway of the internal email is less than 1 meter and the time of to send/receive email by Xeon 5 at 3.0 gigaghertz is  .000,000,000,333,333,333,333,33 using T=D/V, If T = .000,000,000,333,333,333,333,33 seconds then D/V would have a min(Velocity) of D=.09m/V=299,792,458 m/s2 (equal the speed of light) and a max(Velocity) of D=.01m/V=333,333,333 m/s2.(Faster than light). The internal email to self would travel faster than light with one Xeon 5 processor at 3 gigahertz.Simply put the email sent to self would be sent back in time or violate causality.

To expand on this configuration one could set up a Cray XC-30 AC that comes with Linux Suse and install Novell Groupwise and send emails to self. If 1 cabinet of the Cray had 128 Xeon 5 processor that would be 3.0 gigahertz  128 =384 gigahertz of computing power or send/receive an email in 2.6041666666667E-12 seconds or .000,000,000,002,604,166,666,666,7 seconds. If one went all out and had the supercomputer configured with the max or 1024 Xeon processors at 3.0 gigahertz it would send/receive email at 1024 processors x 3.0 gigahertz=3072 gigahertz. It would take 3.2552083333333E-13 seconds or .000,000,000,000,325,520,833,333,33 seconds to send/receive the email. If the pathway of the internal email were .01 m then the speed of the internal email would be 3,072,056,135 m/s2. (theoretically much faster than the speed of light).



Faster-than-light (FTL) travel (Background from Wikipedia)

If  one were able to move information or matter from one point to another faster than light, then according to the theory of relativity, there would be some inertial frame of reference in which the signal or object was moving backward in time. This is a consequence of the relativity of simultaneity in special relativity, which says that in some cases different reference frames will disagree on whether two events at different locations happened "at the same time" or not, and they can also disagree on the order of the two events. Technically, these disagreements occur when the space-time interval between the events is 'space-like', meaning that neither event lies in the future light cone of the other. If one of the two events represents the sending of a signal from one location and the second event represents the reception of the same signal at another location, then as long as the signal is moving at the speed of light or slower, the mathematics of simultaneity ensures that all reference frames agree that the transmission-event happened before the reception-event.


However, in the case of a hypothetical signal moving faster than light, there would always be some frames in which the signal was received before it was sent, so that the signal could be said to have moved backward in time. And since one of the two fundamental postulates of special relativity says that the laws of physics should work the same way in every inertial frame, then if it is possible for signals to move backward in time in any one frame, it must be possible in all frames. This means that if observer A sends a signal to observer B which moves FTL (faster than light) in A's frame but backward in time in B's frame, and then B sends a reply which moves FTL in B's frame but backward in time in A's frame, it could work out that A receives the reply before sending the original signal, a clear violation of causality in every frame. An illustration of such a scenario using space-time diagrams can be found here.The scenario is sometimes referred to as a tachyonic antitelephone.



What We Need

 

I need funding for:

Hardware and software  $10,000

Hardware Consultant $1,000 and Software Consultant $1,000


The Impact

 The impact will not be  trying  to violate any laws of physics. The goal or objective is to test whether the hardware configuration will allow the email to travel in the amount of time that it equals to the speed of light or faster than the speed of light.  I acknowledge that the laws of physics state that the speed limit is the speed of light. But, I believe my configuration will equal to the time of the speed of light or faster than the speed of light which will violate causality (email will be logged or  documented in sent/received box and go back in time).

Challenges

 The biggest challenge is getting funded to test the project.

How you can help

If you can please pledge to make this project happen.

Pass along or share this project with everybody.

Provide feedback or suggestions to make it better or happen.

Also support my other project.

http://igg.me/at/deaddropservice

If two points are connected by a wormhole whose length is shorter than the distance between them outside the wormhole, the time taken to traverse it could be less than the time it would take a light beam to make the journey if it took a path through the space outside the wormhole. However, a light beam traveling through the wormhole would of course beat the traveler.
10. In a Time Worm Hole the time slows down for the email message and the distance is .1 or .2 m which shrinks because the message is near or at the speed of light. The time it takes for the message to be transmitted to self is a lot faster than the time it take for the earth to move in space time even if its not F-T-L.The parallel between the worm hole and the time worm hole is that the worm hole has a shortcut that is space. And the Time Worm Hole is that email sent to self at or near the speed of light  is faster than change in space time of the Earth. The shortcut in Time Worm Hole is time, the time it takes for the email to be sent to self with information is faster (299,792,458 m/s2 ) than the time for the earth to change in space time (30,463 m/s2 ). With respect to Relativity one adds (299,792,458 m/s2 ) and (30,463 m/s2 ) them together  the speed of the email, so the email is going faster than light. (Computer on earth sends email to self).
11. Whether with the fiber optic hollow core band gap version experiment or the CRAY XC 40, theoretically it should work.


12. Can't sent a Terminator back in time to defeat Skynet right now, but, one could send an email back to change events.


Update (8/22/2015)In my projects the goal is to shorten the distance of the email while it is going near the speed of light or at the speed of light. As a result time slows down(Special Relativity). Speed of light is constant but TIME slows down and allows for greater distance to be covered. What will happen if I reduce the distance of the message? If one has the formula time = distance/ velocity then or if velocity is constant speed of light, and distance is .4 m (small distance) and time slows down then the time should also be short at the same time.  (T= .000,000,001 seconds=.4m/299,792,458  m/s 2.)I am attempting to 2 experiments;1. With fiber optic cable(see gallery)2. Supercomputer with a lot of processors(see gallery).In the test with the fiber optic cable, the peed of light will be 189,000,000 m/s up to  290,798,684 m/s 2. So according to Special relativity the time should slow down as it nears the message reaches near the speed of light.In the test with the supercomputer(see gallery), theoretically the distance the email will go is very small and will be computed at a speed equivalent to  3,072,056,135  m/s2. (theoretically much faster than the speed of light).
Either way the message theoretically will go back or near to going back in time with the fiber optic experiment or in the the Cray experiment, it will actually go back in time.MY THEORY OR HYPOTHESISIn both experiments the message will being going near the speed of light or in the Cray experiment, theoretically much faster. The change in space time of the Earth is 30,463 m/s 2 (rotation of Earth on its axis and Earths orbit around Sun). In the Video, the truck was going 50 mph and the ball tossed between the two kids was 10 mph. But the speed of the ball is 60 mph. Now in my experiments the Earth is moving at 30,463 m/s 2 and the message will be going from 189,000,000 up to 290,798,684 m/s 2  in the fiber optic experiments and in the Cray experiment the email will theoretically will be going 3,072,056,135  m/s2. But if you add the speed of the Earth to both experiments, then the speed of the message will be 297,829,147 m/s 2 ( Near the speed of light/ time slows down)in the fiber optic experiments and in the Cray experiment the message will theoretically be going 3,072,056,598  m/s2. (Faster than the speed of light/ Time goes back)I can only test my experiments if you help fund my project. If not share on Facebook or Tweet your Friends. A share on Facebook or Tweet is good as $. 

Short Summary
E-MAIL SERVER'S objective is to test email that violates causality(cause and effect) in which  the time it takes for the message to travel equals to that of a message that goes faster than light (send email back in time). I am aware that nothing can travel faster than the speed of light. But the hardware and software configuration will allow for a message to be tested and document if the time is equal to that of a message that goes faster than the speed of light or violates causality. (equal to or faster than the speed of light and the email will go back in time). Experiment Explained (Technical yet Simple) Fiber Optic Experiment
My hardware and software configuration will allow for a
message to be tested to document if the time is equal to that of a message that
goes faster than the speed of light or violates causality (goes back in time).  This is done
by manipulating the configuration (Length of Pathway of Email Message). 
Using the simple formula Time= Distance/ Velocity the time
for a message traveling at the speed of light would be 
1m (email pathway)

To go faster than the speed of light (in theory)

*(Speed of light in the cable which is refracted is less
than 299,792,458 m/s 2 ). Since the pathway is shorter and the time equals .000,000,002
the speed of the message with pathway of
.4m with velocity or speed of 199,861,638 m/s 2 would be .000,000,002 seconds. It would equal the time
of an email with pathway of 1 meter going in theory 499,654,095 m/s 2 (faster
than light/goes back in time).

Worst case scenario for the experiment with my configuration hardware and software configuration
is that if it does not go faster than light and back in time, the email will be
very fast. The email server with my hardware and software configuration will become a email accelerator.Experiment Explained (Technical more advanced) Cray ExeperimentInternal EmailI was talking to a Novell Groupwise Software Engineer and he told me that the pathway of an email sent to self (ricardo.gil@sbcglobal.net to  ricardo.gil@sbcglobal.net) would be internal. So I calculated the speed  of an internal email. It turns out that a Xeon 5 at 3.0 gigahertz will  equal 3.3333333333333 E-10 seconds or .000,000,000,333,333,333,333,33  seconds to send/receive email. Given T=D/V, if the distance were 1  m/299,792,458 m/s2 the time would equal to 3.33564095E-9 seconds or .000,000,003,335,640,95 seconds (speed of light). Since the pathway of the internal email is  less than 1 meter and the time of to send/receive email by Xeon 5 at 3.0 gigaghertz is   .000,000,000,333,333,333,333,33 using T=D/V, If T =  .000,000,000,333,333,333,333,33 seconds then D/V would have a  min(Velocity) of D=.09m/V=299,792,458 m/s2 (equal the speed of light)  and a max(Velocity) of D=.01m/V=333,333,333 m/s2.(Faster than light).  The internal email to self would travel faster than light with one Xeon 5 processor at 3 gigahertz.Simply put the email sent to self would be  sent back in time or violate causality. To expand on this configuration one could set up a Cray XC-30 AC that  comes with Linux Suse and install Novell Groupwise and send emails to  self. If 1 cabinet of the Cray had 128 Xeon 5 processor that would be  3.0 gigahertz  128 =384 gigahertz of computing power or send/receive an  email in 2.6041666666667E-12 seconds or .000,000,000,002,604,166,666,666,7 seconds. If one went all out and had the supercomputer configured with  the max or 1024 Xeon processors at 3.0 gigahertz it would send/receive  email at 1024 processors x 3.0 gigahertz=3072 gigahertz. It would take 3.2552083333333E-13 seconds or .000,000,000,000,325,520,833,333,33 seconds to send/receive the email. If the pathway of the internal email were .01 m then the speed of the internal email would be 3,072,056,135  m/s2. (theoretically much faster than the speed of light).
Faster-than-light (FTL) travel (Background from Wikipedia)


If  one were able to move information or matter from one point
to another faster
than light, then according to the theory of relativity,
there would be some inertial frame
of reference in which the signal or object was moving backward in time.
This is a consequence of the relativity of
simultaneity in special relativity, which says that in some cases different
reference frames will disagree on whether two events at different locations
happened "at the same time" or not, and they can also disagree on the
order of the two events. Technically, these disagreements occur when the space-time interval
between the events is 'space-like', meaning that neither event lies in the
future light cone of the
other. If one of the two events represents the sending of a signal from one
location and the second event represents the reception of the same signal at
another location, then as long as the signal is moving at the speed of light or
slower, the mathematics of simultaneity ensures that all reference frames agree
that the transmission-event happened before the reception-event.

However, in the case of a hypothetical signal moving faster than 
light, there would always be some frames in which the signal was 
received before it was sent, so that the signal could be said to have 
moved backward in time. And since one of the two fundamental postulates of special relativity
 says that the laws of physics should work the same way in every 
inertial frame, then if it is possible for signals to move backward in 
time in any one frame, it must be possible in all frames. This means 
that if observer A sends a signal to observer B which moves FTL (faster 
than light) in A's frame but backward in time in B's frame, and then B 
sends a reply which moves FTL in B's frame but backward in time in A's 
frame, it could work out that A receives the reply before sending the 
original signal, a clear violation of causality in every frame. An illustration of such a scenario using space-time diagrams can be found here.The scenario is sometimes referred to as a tachyonic antitelephone.
   



What We Need 
 I need funding for:
Hardware and software  $10,000
Hardware Consultant $1,000 and Software Consultant $1,000

  The Impact The impact will not be  trying  to violate any laws of physics. The goal or objective is to test whether the hardware configuration will allow the email to travel in the amount of time that it equals to the speed of light or faster than the speed of light.  I acknowledge that the laws of physics state that the speed limit is the speed of light. But, I believe my configuration will equal to the time of the speed of light or faster than the speed of light which will violate causality (email will be logged or  documented in sent/received box and go back in time).  Challenges  The biggest challenge is getting funded to test the project.

How you can help
If you can please pledge to make this project happen.
Pass along or share this project with everybody.
Provide feedback or suggestions to make it better or happen. 
Also support my other project.
http://igg.me/at/deaddropservice

story:
Gaza strip-Palestine 


Define myself

I Mahmoud Hijazi from gaza strip-palesine i work volunteer in nursing at Abu Yousef al-Najjar Hospital finished my studies at the university in 2012 Bachelor of Nursing and i work in al nour association and in family of good deeds campaign Also work to help the needy and help the poor and needy, orphans and infirm By collecting donations in various ways to provide assistance and reduce the spread of disease and provide food, food and drink Also work to strengthen and provide psycho social support to children and orphans.


for support Gaza strip -Palestine 

Who (or what) you’re raising money for???

 I raising money for I have collected donations for the children of Gaza strip -Palestine  to buy clothes and mitigate the winter cold

We reached the goal of many children in days  and stretch goal of 200 children with 20 days left. For the final week of February we're pushing ourselves to give the max - all 200 children we can impact!


How the money will be used??

To buy winter clothes for more than 200 children Paints a smile on their faces and give them warmth


when need the funds??

during 20 days i need to collect 10$ for every child 

to reached 200 child

Make a child smile at winter  

Make a child warmth in winter


In 2014 after the recent war in the Gaza Strip after the destruction of many houses on the heads of their owners and killed entire families

Came the winter where there are children deprived not dress, no food, no shelter children are deprived of the right to live and play

We want to contribute to the purchase of winter clothing for children and orphans

  Simple far contributed support for children $ 10 for children to buy winter clothes in the Gaza Strip

When helping child deprived of the basic needs of life will be the cause of happiness

And pray you

Only $10 for new winter clothes for a child and orphans

We need to provide new winter clothes for up to 200 children. Your donation of only$10 can provide a child with new clothes and happiness and warmth in winter.Sponsor groups of children so we can reach our goal to provide all of the children with new clothes. Select a Reward on the right to sponsor one child or a group of children.

Make a difference to needy children

Your support will put a smile on a child's face as they prepare for winter and show them that there are people around the world who care about them. It will also warm your heart to know that you made a difference in child's life.

Can you donate from outside the USA? 

Absolutely.The way to donate internationally is with a credit card. indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.

I must thank everyone who have a heart and a humanitarian 

thank you

Allah blessed all

photos form my work 

The distribution of money to orphans

Food distribution to physically disabled


To distribute food baskets to the poor family's

To ease children psychologically

story:
Short Summary

Sylvia Yordanova is someone who has dedicated her entire life to children. Always looking for ways to help children learn how to better interact with the world around them, she is committed to ensuring safety and growth among kids between the ages of 4 and 8, knowing that kids are our future and striving to protect them and lend them a hand in any way that she can.

When Sylvia witnessed a fire at her friend’s house, her life and her mindset took a sharp turn. The fire, which had been started by Sylvia’s friend’s 6-year-old son, was devastating, but out of this tragedy, Sylvia saw the opportunity to do some good. She set out to write Playing with Fire, a children’s book designed to teach valuable lessons about fire safety.

In Playing with Fire, Bart starts a campfire while he is playing with his friends in the forest. He is careless with the fire, causing problems that could have been easily avoided.

This story is all-too-relevant and all-too-familiar in our communities, and by writing Playing with Fire, Sylvia has created an opportunity for kids to learn about fire safety the easy way rather than the hard way. In addition to the picture book itself, there is a supplementary activity book included in the Playing with Fire bundle. We will be collaborating with fire departments to distribute this book around schools and neighborhoods, in addition to offering digital, audio, and video formats of the story. Despite its many forms, however, his is more than just a book: it is a comprehensive, effective fire prevention program.

Some responses we already had from USA Fire Districts:

"Bravo!  What a valuable and worthwhile venture on behalf of our children. We will post the names of the book/video and link to the book on the fire department website on the Fire Safety page. We can encourage families to review the material. I would also ask you reach out the local Public School district."

"Thank you so much for contacting our Fire Department regarding your book Playing with Fire.  We have a comprehensive fire prevention program with our local schools which we visit every year and we would be happy to include this in our education program. Also, we will be interested in purchasing the book to hand out to students."

What We Need & What You Get

We are turning to you, Indiegogo, for help raising $5,069. This start-up capital will cover the costs of IBSNs, marketing, press releases, press release distribution, global licensing and distribution rights, and printing. You can see a more detailed breakdown of our costs in the graphic below. $3,150, more than half our target, is being deducted to send free printed book bundles to 225 different libraries and schools, benefitting poor families and children in need. As a thank-you, we will be offering to our contributors the print, digital, audio, and video versions of Playing with Fire at a significant discount.


 

The Impact

There is no way to overstate just how important Playing with Fire is. This is a fire prevention program that will actually capture children’s attention and keep them entertained so that they absorb the information and lessons necessary to keeping them safe and to keeping our communities safe.

If you have ever seen a house gutted by a fire, whether in person or in pictures, you can imagine the horror that such an incident ushers into every life that it touches. We want to prevent such horror any way that we can, and getting this book out to young readers is one way that is simple, easy, and efficient.

Risks & Challenges

As with any new book, distribution is a challenge, but because we are confident that fire departments will support Playing with Fire wholeheartedly, this is one book that comes with an audience built-in. Whatever challenges come up, we are sure that we are prepared to face them for the good of this program.

 

About Us

Children under 5 are twice as likely to get hurt or die in a fire According to American Red Cross. Teaching them fire safety is critical. The topic can be confusing and scary for them, but our book does an excellent job of helping to teach them while making it fun. This is a brilliant way to start the conversation or reinforce what you are already teaching them about fire safety. It strikes the right balance between story and a fire safety lesson.

Did you watch this video recently? Have a look again!

 

One last request: We need your help spreading the word

We appreciate all monetary contributions, of course, but you can make an even bigger impact on this campaign by posting our URL https://igg.me/at/fireDanger on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, or any other social media platforms you use. The more people know about Playing with Fire, the more widely we can get this book distributed.

All contributions, monetary and otherwise, are greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your time.

Sylvia Yordanova

Author of Playing with Fire and founder of Kiddy Books

Sylvia@kiddy-books.biz

http://kiddy-books.biz
