story:
Estoy convencida que el rezago que afecta al sector salud en México tiene una solución y ésta se vincula directamente a la tecnología. Digitalización, Inteligencia Artificial, y Telecomunicaciones son los tres pilares sobre los cuales será posible revolucionar al sector más importante de México.

​

Es cierto que se han dado pasos importantes en este sentido, pero también es indudable queda mucho por hacer. Soy Karen Sujo, tengo mucho que aportarle a mi país, y necesito tu ayuda.

Sé que es posible sumar esfuerzos y conocimiento y esa será mi aportación.  

¿Cuál es el problema que quiero resolver?

A pesar de los avances tecnológicos médicos de los últimos años, como telemáticos y biosensores, el desarrollo en el sector de salud pública ha permanecido estático en México. Actualmente el país cuenta con un rezago en telecomunicaciones, lo que imposibilita el acceso de gran parte de la población a dicha tecnología.

La implementación de dispositivos telemáticos en el sector salud tiene el potencial de disminuir el gasto público resultante de trasladar pacientes de locaciones remotas a grandes ciudades, donde se encuentra la mayor concentración de doctores per capita e infraestructura médica.

Anualmente, el IMSS lleva a cabo 20 millones de estudios de imagenología médica. No obstante, estos estudios son actualmente archivados en formato físico. En formato digital, por otra parte, dichas imágenes pueden integrarse las bases de datos que alimentan diversas implementaciones de inteligencia artificial.

La transformación digital de los procesos de diagnóstico médico oportuno, además de reducir costos, puede incluso, en el largo plazo mejorar la calidad de vida de los mexicanos, proporcionándoles diagnósticos para prevención o temprana atención de sus afecciones, y reduciendo drásticamente los casos que se presentan en una sala de emergencias.

Dadas las dimensiones de población y del territorio mexicano, la forma más eficiente para recolección y transmisión de datos puede hacer uso del desarrollo de diversas tecnologías como lo son sistemas de telecomunicaciones por cable terrestre, antena, o satélite en caso de ondas electromagnéticas.

Para emprender este tipo de proyectos es necesaria la colaboración entre el sector público y privado.

¿Qué es el bootcamp de tecnología e Innovación de MIT?

El MIT Technology & Innovation Bootcamp busca fomentar la creación y ejecución de proyectos con un enfoque tecnológico con potencial para contribuir a la sociedad a través de la innovación.

Proceso de Reclutamiento

  • Alrededor de 55,000 personas toman el curso de emprendimiento en línea impartido por MIT
  • 840 aplicaciones son recibidas anualmente para una plaza el Bootcamp presencial
  • El 8.6% de estas aplicaciones recibe una oferta de admisión, representando el 0.1% de la población inicial

¿Qué necesito?

  • Costo de Colegiatura  - US$8,000
  • Tranporte a Japón  - US$1,300
  • Viáticos - US$600

Total  US$ 9,900

Anualmente, el IMSS lleva a cabo 20 millones de estudios de imagenología médica. No obstante, estos estudios son actualmente archivados en formato físico. En formato digital, por otra parte, dichas imágenes pueden integrarse las bases de datos que alimentan diversas implementaciones de inteligencia artificial.
La transformación digital de los procesos de diagnóstico médico oportuno, además de reducir costos, puede incluso, en el largo plazo mejorar la calidad de vida de los mexicanos, proporcionándoles diagnósticos para prevención o temprana atención de sus afecciones, y reduciendo drásticamente los casos que se presentan en una sala de emergencias.
Dadas las dimensiones de población y del territorio mexicano, la forma más eficiente para recolección y transmisión de datos puede hacer uso del desarrollo de diversas tecnologías como lo son sistemas de telecomunicaciones por cable terrestre, antena, o satélite en caso de ondas electromagnéticas.
Para emprender este tipo de proyectos es necesaria la colaboración entre el sector público y privado.

¿Qué es el bootcamp de tecnología e Innovación de MIT?
El MIT Technology & Innovation Bootcamp busca fomentar la creación y ejecución de proyectos con un enfoque tecnológico con potencial para contribuir a la sociedad a través de la innovación.

Proceso de Reclutamiento

Alrededor de 55,000 personas toman el curso de emprendimiento en línea impartido por MIT
840 aplicaciones son recibidas anualmente para una plaza el Bootcamp presencial
El 8.6% de estas aplicaciones recibe una oferta de admisión, representando el 0.1% de la población inicial

¿Qué necesito?

Costo de Colegiatura  - US$8,000

Tranporte a Japón  - US$1,300

Viáticos - US$600


Total  US$ 9,900

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Ariel McCasland; I am a professional nanny and Reiki master. I am seeking help in funding my training to become a doula. Currently in the United States, about 1 in 3 American babies are born via cesarean. And, according to a 2017 Consumer Reports study, about 26 percent of healthy women with low-risk pregnancies and full-term babies positioned headfirst— and therefore typically considered equipped to deliver vaginally—end up undergoing c-sections. In other words, our current system for maternal care regularly fails women, stripping them of their autonomy, and leaving birth workers caught in its grinders burnt out. We need a new frame work. I believe Angela Gallo's Dynamo Doula Training teaches the vision and the skills to bring about a revolution of radical compassion and a rebirth of how we care for mothers and their families as they transition into the new stage of parenthood. It is vital. Please help me get this information to the United States, especially the South East, where I live. This training course covers everything from fertilization to birth trauma and how to help through the postpartum (4th trimester) stage. 

What We Need & What You Get

The Dynamo Doula Training program costs 2,999 Australian Dollars; so I am asking for

$2,050 American dollars,

which is based on the current exchange rate. I will be sending it all to the program, which is a 24 week program that begins November 1st. I must complete the program within that 24 weeks to get certified. This means proof of your contribution will come quickly as I keep everyone posted on my progress. 

  • Those that contribute $400 or more, I will paint a commissioned piece for them. (I paint floor monsters and dinosaurs; Pictures of them will be on the perks page.)
  • If I do not meet my entire goal by November 1st. I will put the money into a savings account and continue saving until I have the full amount. I will then take the course the next time they open enrollment (the following November 1st). 

The Impact

This shift in how we care for mothers and how birth workers are trained is imperative. We must bring humanity back to this right of passage. I will manage to save the money eventually with or without hope; contributing will enable me to get this training more quickly and bring this needed vision to the United States. I finish projects that I start. I graduated Summa Cum laude from the University of Tennessee, Knoxville with a B.A. in Psychology. I studied Reiki, rather than go to grad-school, because our models of medicine are flawed. We rely too much on medicine instead of harnessing our own abilities to heal and to experience growth/post-traumatic growth. This is the next step in my personal evolution and me living out my purpose of bringing necesary change to our medical systems, through healing and radical compassio

Risks & Challenges

The challenge is I need to have the full amount $2,050 by November 1st in order to enroll, or I will have to wait another year before enrolling. I will put the money into a separate savings account at a credit union if I do not meet my goal. With what I do manage to collect, I will have the rest saved by next enrollment. I am passionate and driven to get this training!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute, please go check out Angela Gallo at angelagallo.com. See this program and her vision for yourself. Also feel free to check out rainbowflamehealing.com or my Instagram to see my journey unfolding. Infinite gratitude to everyone!

story:
Our Story

Imagine yourself living in a place where is no electricity and water,
So not having Facebook is just a starter.
It’s Monday morning 8 o’ clock,
With no breakfast in stock.

A glass of water would be so nice,
But over here it’s no paradise.
So you grab your jerrycan and put it on your head,
Walking for 10 k is better than having nothing instead.

On the road you meet a girl going to school,
But in your house that’s not the rule.
As your mum left this world being way too young,
Tries father with HIV to remain strong.
While it’s hard to understand why,
There is not much time for you to cry.
Work on the land needs to be done,
So school is not a place you seem to belong. 

Meanwhile it’s already late,
So you have to go to the garden straight.
Harvesting maize is your activity of the day,
Trying not to think of food along the way.

After 4 hours working in the heat,
It’s finally time for your treat.
Here is your breakfast, lunch and dinner in one time,
Two potatoes everyday is just fine.

Becoming a pilot is what you dream about,
But without going to school it’s hard to say out loud.
So you’re heading to the school you saw today,
And wish you could be like them and play.

Where this seems to be impossible for you,
Is that certainly not true.
In Maris Junior School there is place for all the poor,
They just need to expand a little more.

A second building is in the make,
However, 7.000 euros is what it’s going to take.

Now imagine yourself on a Friday night,
You probably go for a drink or a bite.
When you had your beer and want some more.
Please, just order three instead of four.
And give the saving of the night,
To one of the buttons on the right.

Not into beer?

You're not such a beer drinker but still want to help us? You can always spread the word. Tell your grandmother, friends or share this project via Facebook, Instagram, Linkedin or any other social media. 

Not into credit cards? 

Not such a fan of credit cards but more into ideal payments? You can donate your beer via this link: donate via ideal

story:
Eduisfun - Play To Learn

We make learning fun, easy & accessible to everyone through games. Our educational games help to learn concepts of Mathematics / Science & prepare for various exams and Olympiads for Grades 1 to 10! We want to make quality education available to students across the globe delivered in a fun & engaging way.

Eduisfun - is a perfect blend of education & game, with a vast question bank covering over 10,000+ concepts. We offer a comprehensive learning program for K-10 students. Master all concepts by playing games that are designed to help students learn in the most fun and engaging way!

 

Knowledge Kombat - Learning Games

In the quest to win Knowledge Lamps, become a Superbrainiac and defeat the animal kind, students engross themselves in a 4 in 1 series of conceptual question sets, designed to be adaptive, personalised, measuring kid’s accuracy as well as speed. Conquering one island after the other, saving themselves from the sharks of animal kind - kids trace their way up to the Treasure Chest for the ultimate victory. To ensure sustained improvement, comprehensive and personalised performance reports are generated for kids and are real time shared with parents as well as teachers.

 

Snail Rush - Multiplayer Olympiad Preparation Games

After having conquered all knowledge lamps, comes the test to win the real-time race with superbrainiacs. Covering all concepts of olympiads/ logical reasoning/ General Science and more, students take part in this exciting Snail race, to make it to the leader boards globally! Excitement ramps up and adrenaline rush touches skies when kids get to choose their snails to be their super-hero - be it a Messi or Harry Potter! Well knit with AI & adaptive learning, students interact with their opponents real time, get a comprehensive performance report and keep refining their problem solving skills with the mission of winning the race of Super brainiacs!

 

Stages of Gamified Learning

Gamified Learning Slate

What Do You Get

We have tied up with a Silicon Valley based shipping company who has a lot of experience with shipping of Indiegogo products. They have their warehouse in San Francisco, Ireland and Hong Kong.

Backers from Europe will get their reward from Ireland, backers from North and South America will get their rewards via US and backers from rest of the world will receive their rewards from Hong Kong. 

We'll email you the tracking numbers as soon as we have them! 

Get in touch with us  

If you have questions at any time, during or after the campaign, you can always reach us at support@eduisfun.com or leave a comment on this page.  

Our heartfelt gratitude goes out to the following people for helping us throughout our journey!

story:
The task of this toy is to teach the brain to learn, to start the work of the pituitary gland, thus ensuring the interaction between the right and left hemisphere. Playing the child, being in the zone of actual development and following the instructions, through certain algorithms for solving problems, lays in the brain subcortex neural paths, which eventually turn into a powerful, active, working neural network. Since it works simultaneously, concentration, motor skills and memory, a polarization effect or a cognitive jump occurs in the brain. Since the pituitary gland is activated, the child, unaware, begins to take information directly from space, interacting at this moment with the space-time characteristics (Vernadsky's noosphere, academician). Quantum physicists call this effect a “quantum jump”. At the same time, the body begins to produce hormones of happiness: the neurotransmitter Dopamine is responsible for making decisions and endogenous opiates (have anti-stress and analgesic effects, reduce appetite, normalize the pressure and respiration rate, accelerates regeneration processes in the body), thanks to these processes for 2 -3 sessions of a child's game increase not only the motivation to learn, but also, as it were, spontaneously improve communication skills, as well as increase social adaptation. This toy, if correctly implemented, is a worthy alternative to gadgets.

Such parameters of intelligence as learning ability, flexibility, depth and strategic thinking, openness to novelty and critical thinking are developed.

The game is based on the basis of the unique Binardik device, which was created as a result of a special project in 1960, famous Soviet academician and inventor R. Yu. Fedoseev. The device, for a very long time, was a closed development, designed specifically for the development of the mental abilities of a certain contingent of persons (including for astronauts and intelligence officers). This device allowed us to train visual memory as quickly as possible, to improve concentration of attention, logical abilities and, most importantly, to develop systems thinking for working with large volumes of information.

And the history of the creation of the special project "Binardik" is:

The year was 1960.
The son of a major party worker began to have serious academic problems. It was very difficult for the child to study. I think this situation is close to many of us, whose children went to school and began to “nibble on the granite of science”. The boy's father really wanted to help him. Opportunities and resources were. A specific task was set, which also appealed to other party comrades who also had children. The task was formulated clearly - to develop a method that allows making a “round high school student” from the most lagging student. To solve this problem, the best specialists of various fields were involved. Psychologists, teachers, doctors, specialists in the field of “bourgeois science” informatics and neurophysiologists took part in the work. A huge amount of information and developments from all areas related to human development has been reworked. That was certainly the case when the slogan “All the Best to Children” worked 100%. The result of this titanic work was a unique method of development, which allows you to “raise” the student's performance in the shortest possible time. The technique was based on a device called “Binardik”.

Created the key to the abilities of almost every child!

The task has been solved! The father achieved his goal - his son became an excellent student. Like many other children from the ruling elite of the time. They got this “golden key” to the gate of education. Phenomenal memory, developed logical abilities, multiplied by the trained attention - all this became possible to develop with the systematic use of the system and the device "binard".

story:
At YogaBears we believe in children, their positive development, their increased self-esteem and their strong self-image. We believe that by investing in our children’s emotional intelligence, we will develop all children, irrespective of ability, wealth, gender, race and religion to become strong, balanced, loving, confident, creative individuals. We have created our very own soft toy, YogaBear family. These Bears are going to help us fulfil our mission of Yoga and Mindfulness for children.

 

The Why?

 

My name is Estelle and I am the creator of YogaBears.

I am an Early Years practitioner and qualified Children's, Children with disabilities and Adult Yoga Teacher.

My enthusiasm for Yoga is driven by my passion for its Physical and Mental attributes.

My enthusiasm for a Child's development is driven by my passion to empower our children to understand their super-powers as individuals.

Super-powers are the child friendly term that we have chosen to depict emotional intelligence with children. We aim to engage the children in activities and learning that guides the children through self-awareness, self-control, the ability to express their emotions, to handle interpersonal relationships with empathy and to begin to understand self-trust and the use of their own judgement. We bring this to life visually through our YogaBear toys who are carefully created to resonate the teachings.

In society, social media is changing younger generations childhoods. Children are encountering situations that as Adults we encountered much later in life, such as personal image perception, popularity, access to non age appropriate images & content and so much more.

The world and society is also evolving with parenting conflictions, education systems, health service provision all rapidly changing and available budget cutting and so on.

At home, with my two children Michael & Jasmine, I combined my love for Yoga & Children and created YogaBears.

YogaBears began as an interactive series of classes, that follow a magical syllabus based around the eastern teachings of energy centres or chakras, as they are known. In non Yoga terms, emotional intelligence.

Based in the North West of England we have managed to engage over 350 children from all backgrounds.

We have created YogaBear Universities where childcare professionals along with child focused yoga teachers, are taught and accredited to become a licensed YogaBears Teacher.

So why are we here?

We have created our very own YogaBear Soft Toy family.

We have 7 Bears in total, each specially designed to engage our children, in firstly the mental aspects of Yoga/Chakra/EI and then leading them to the physical aspect.

For example:

Meet Mula.

Mula is our Red Bear and his symbol is a Tree.

Mula guides our children through the root energy centre, teaching children to be grounded and have strong roots and flexible branches that move through the seasons, graceful in change.

We can all relate to Mula as adults and how we strive to set strong personal foundations to help ground us for all the future challenges ahead.

Our Vison

Is that our YogaBears will be interactive tools for the children, families, schools, nursery schools all to enjoy.

Each Bear directs the Children to our Website where they can find more information about the Bears, their meanings and also the related postures.

Progress

We have our Bears currently being manufactured and they are due to be shipped in the coming month.

Our Request

We need your help to make our vision a reality.

Our company is still in its infancy stage and thus far we have spent over $10,000 dollars in the design & production stage and also the Legal & Administrative stages also.

Future Costs that are to be paid

$9230 for the finish order of Bears.

$2800 for the Shipping of the Bears.

$1750 for the packaging design costs.

$5500 for a marketing campaign that will include all media outlets inclusive of Children’s TV

$2000 for Soft Toy Trade Show facilitation in January

Total $21,280 

As a Business we have pledged that for each YogaBear sold £0.85 will be assigned to a fund that will assist in community projects, led by our YogaBear Teachers currently based in the UK, Ireland, USA & India.

Your Investment will help a business that is entwined with love, authenticity and a passion to empower children to build a brighter future all.

We will welcome any donation and please if you can not donate financially then please look us up on social media and help share ur story.  We are grateful for your time and energy spent reading ur story so far.

What happens if...?

What happens if we are unsuccessful in our goal?

The monies will be used directly towards the shipping and the marketing as we have identified these as our keys areas in fulfilment of our mission.

Risks

Financial Risks - As a relatively new business, cash reserves and cash management are key to the longevity of the business. We have recently recruited Vicky who joins us from one of the leading International Banks, where she enjoyed 12 years of work, her last post being in Corporate & Commercial Banking.

Legal Risks - Since inception we have taken advice from and been guided by IPO lawyers. Our brand is trademarked and our Bears are copyright protected. The Bears have been passed for safety inspection and are not advertised as suitable for 0-3 years.

Competition Risk - After market analysis we understand that our Bears could be seen as, just another Teddy Bear. We know that for us to gain market share and grow our brand will be a challenge, however, our network of yoga studios across the globe is our first port of call as Bear distributors, secondly our network of professionals and retail outlet procurement teams will help us place the bears in mainstream stores.

month.Our RequestWe need your help to make our vision a reality.Our company is still in its infancy stage and thus far we have spent over $10,000 dollars in the design & production stage and also the Legal & Administrative stages also.Future Costs that are to be paid$9230 for the finish order of Bears.$2800 for the Shipping of the Bears.$1750 for the packaging design costs.$5500 for a marketing campaign that will include all media outlets inclusive of Children’s TV$2000 for Soft Toy Trade Show facilitation in JanuaryTotal $21,280 As a Business we have pledged that for each YogaBear sold £0.85 will be assigned to a fund that will assist in community projects, led by our YogaBear Teachers currently based in the UK, Ireland, USA & India.Your Investment will help a business that is entwined with love, authenticity and a passion to empower children to build a brighter future all.We will welcome any donation and please if you can not donate financially then please look us up on social media and help share ur story.  We are grateful for your time and energy spent reading ur story so far.What happens if...?What happens if we are unsuccessful in our goal?The monies will be used directly towards the shipping and the marketing as we have identified these as our keys areas in fulfilment of our mission.RisksFinancial Risks - As a relatively new business, cash reserves and cash management are key to the longevity of the business. We have recently recruited Vicky who joins us from one of the leading International Banks, where she enjoyed 12 years of work, her last post being in Corporate & Commercial Banking.Legal Risks - Since inception we have taken advice from and been guided by IPO lawyers. Our brand is trademarked and our Bears are copyright protected. The Bears have been passed for safety inspection and are not advertised as suitable for 0-3 years.Competition Risk - After market analysis we understand that our Bears could be seen as, just another Teddy Bear. We know that for us to gain market share and grow our brand will be a challenge, however, our network of yoga studios across the globe is our first port of call as Bear distributors, secondly our network of professionals and retail outlet procurement teams will help us place the bears in mainstream stores.

story:
Who am I?

I am a researcher and popular science author from Poland. I work at The Institute of Sex Research in Opole.

In 2011, I published the book "Homo eroticus" discussing human sexuality evolution, which earned highest professionals' appraisal, inter alia, is recommended as a textbook for university students (see more at the book's page; in English). 

Now, I undergo a research on the title question, which additionally serves as PhD dissertation in The SWPS University of Humanities and Social Science in Warsaw (supervisor: Full Professor Wojciech Burszta).

You may find more about me at Wikipedia (English), and also at Google Scholar or Academia.edu. 

 

Why this theme?

Each sensitive and thoughtful person must consider, how it is possible that in the XXI century, there are still circumcised boys and girls in traditional societies in extreme unsanitary conditions, what throughout immense suffering often leads to serious postoperative complications and frequently to death. E.g., in 2013, only in one province in the South Africa Republic, 30 young people was dead, while near 300 had to be hospitalized after tribal circumcision season (the press report see here).

What is also intriguing, this rituals are usually the most solemn and important festivity for the societies involved, so even highly educated members of the societies often oppose toward abandon these rituals because they treat them as the feature of community's ethnic identity. Also, there are the Jewish circumcision, Islamic one, and modern medico-hygienic form of it (particularly in US, Canada, UK, and Australia), and there are not quite clear links between all these forms. This is what was an incentive to investigate the case.

 

The Significance of the Project

The most important is a scientific and cognitive end. Simply, it is worth to emerge our strictly verified knowledge on the topic that has been intrigued thinkers for over a century. At the same outset of the research yet, it proved that the science could not fully resolve the problem of the sense of circumcision rituals for over 100 years, though the problem was investigated by so great thinkers as E. Durkheim, C. Levi-Strauss, M. Eliade, E. Leach, and V. Turner. The latest profound work on this subject was published 30 years ago (La Fontaine J.S., Initiation, London 1985), so it is worth to investigate the matter in the light of the newest findings of science.

Secondly, the research has great practical significance: educational and humanitarian. The knowledge on factual causes of introduction of circumcision rituals to human culture could help us to demonstrate the tribal cultures an obsolete and outdated character of this rituals and would serve the elimination of tribal circumcision from everyday life.

And lastly, earning of a PhD degree is only an occasional end--assures that the research has highest possible academic quality.

 

What We Need

The research ongoing is advanced in about 80% now. The sum of 2,800 $ is needed to complete it. It proved impossible to obtain any grants in Poland. In this country, public subsidies for the science are one of the smallest in the democratic Europe, whereas the private ones do not existence at all!

The funds would be used for:

  • purchase missing materials (books, articles, database, reports), which will enable the completion of the study.
  • purchase editing services (typewriting, layout, tables & pictures) leading to make a sample print of dissertation.
  • costs of 3 academic reviews necessary to attribute the work fully scientific form.

 

What Will Be Done?

The research will show that the genesis of ritual circumcision should be dated back by many millennia and the rituals must be included to the oldest rituals of man. Importantly, the birth of this ritual accompanied a fundamental change of the social system, which allowed each male--not only the so called "alpha males"--to mate with females. This is why this ritual was (and is) so common and momentous in traditional cultures. 

In the next stage, the work as PhD dissertation will be defensed at the aforementioned University and an extensive English summary will be done.

If there would be a surplus in funds, we could do:

  • translate entire work into English;
  • prepare for publishing as e-book and paper-book in both Polish and English;
  • make the research report and send it to institutions undergoing campaignes against practicing tribal circumcision.

 

What We Offer

We can offer few perks for backers in short distance, because the research is written in Polish first and will be fully translated to English a little later.

So, immediately in the campaign, we can offer:

  • for all backers - acknowledgments showing their merits (in e-mail);
  • for donating 5 $ and more - diploma of merit from the Author and the Institute.
  • for donating 10 $ and more - what above & an earlier e-book of the author: The short history of homosexual emancipation, The Institute of Sex Research Press, Opole, 2015 (in English).

 

At the other hand, we offer--after completion of the work:

  • for donating 15 $ and more - what above & an extensive English summary of the work immediately after the defense of PhD dissertation;
  • for donating 20 $ and more - what above & e-book with the work (in English);
  • for donating 25 $ and more - what above & paper-book with the work (in English).

 

Also, we propose two Special Prizes as extra supplements:

  • for 4 persons donating the highest amount - naming them in  the text of dissertation, e-book & paper-book among those who contributed the most to the work;
  • for a person donating the highest amount - what above & an additional Special Prize that is a Secret Perk and will be disclosed at the end of the campaign by sending the winner a special link.

 

Is success in the research ensured?

The author warrants the highest scientific quality of the work. Yet his pre-doctoral book demonstrated this when serving as a university textbook. Also, he published a scientific article in one of the world's most prominent journal in sexology, The Journal of Homosexuality (see here).

However, some risks and obstacles may occur. Mainly, the amount collected might be not enough to complete the research. Yet, flexible method of collecting enables the work accordingly to funds  gathered and the collection would be continued by another ways.

 

If You Can't Contribute...

...it doesn't mean you can't help. You may also: ask people to get the word out and make some noise about that campaign, e.g., using the Indiegogo share tools.

For all forms of helping--a great deal of thanks!

story:
The Untold Story of Pakistan

Let us tell you a story. Two girls from Pakistan saved up for a year & decided to finally tick "Travel the world" off their bucket lists & bought a ticket to another country. With our itinerary prepared & destinations decided, we hopped on the plane, excited to have the time of our lives. We reached the destined country, settled in & headed out to sight seeing. We spoke to a few people on the way to get directions and we were asked one question every time: "Where are you from?" "Pakistan" was our chirpy response. There would be a confused look on their faces. "Really, how do you speak English so well?", "Are girls in Pakistan allowed to go out?!" etc. We were taken aback initially, however, we decided to grab the opportunity & become the ambassadors of our country.  We had lively conversations with people and they were amazed to know of life in Pakistan. Some of them even expressed a wish to visit us when we go back!
When we returned, we pondered over our experience & the negative image of Pakistan that is being portrayed to the world. 
When we spoke to people around us, we realized even within Pakistan, people are not much hopeful. We went out to speak to people on the roads, in schools, shopping malls; we spoke to hawkers, shopkeepers, taxi drivers; most of them had the similar response, "Pakistan mein tou aese hi hota hai" (This what happens & will keep on happening in Pakistan). This hit us harder, to know our own people are so hopeless. This made us realize that the negativity is inherent within us, it's claws are strongly dug within our minds, we need to change our own perspective before we venture out to change the outside world's.
Living in Pakistan means facing a series of never-ending contradictions. There is the innate hopefulness of the future yet the hopelessness of the surroundings; there is the passion to defy the odds yet the fear of the conservative society; there is the urge to explore life yet the terror of religious extremism; despite all this, the country strives on. 
Isn't it unfair to term a nation of 191,316,136 people as being extremists, conservatives & (hurts to even mention) terrorists? Yes, Pakistan is facing a lot of challenges today, but this is also our reality:

  • Pakistan is ranked among the least racist countries of the world
  • Pakistan hosts the largest number of refugees in the world
  • Pakistan is the largest contributor to UN Peacekeeping mission 

Pakistan is an enigma to many and a tragedy to some. But can you imagine the resilience and the courage of the people living here who had all the reasons to give up but never did; that's what we want to share with the world. 
We are a team on 3 very proud Pakistani girls & we wish to bring to front the unsung heroes, who within their capacity are overcoming all hindrances and making this world a better place for themselves and others. 

What is Mera Passion Pakistan (MPP)?

MPP is a digital media initiative conceived and implemented to highlight success stories of citizens belonging to a humble background - stories of their courage, integrity, innovation & resolution. 
MPP's team constantly searches for heroes, records their achievements and shares them on social media to:
  • Change perspectives
  • Showcase stories of optimism
  • Nurture role-models
  • Inspire positive action&
  • Transform the way the world sees Pakistan

How Did Mera Passion Pakistan Start?

Great things always begin with visionaries...MPP was envisioned by Irfan Mustafa, a corporate titan, philanthropist and a true patriot at heart. He was named as one of the Pakistan Power 100. On his extensive travels around the world, the negative image of Pakistan which was being portrayed around the world, bothered him. He started Mera Passion Pakistan & entrusted the School of Leadership with the task. He invested the seed money which helped the team in gaining ground.  


How We See Pakistan?

People think we clip our children’s wings and don’t let them soar high. These people do not know the story of a visionary man from Kyber PakhtunKhwa, who despite being a motor mechanic, has built a plane! People say Pakistan has no facilities for the disabled but little do they know that there are many hidden stories of courage and resilience spread throughout Pakistan where people have overcome their disabilities and have become great achievers. People in urban areas suffer from water shortage, whereas there are people in the northern areas who took it upon themselves and set up Hydroelectric Power Plants. 

See their stories here:


The MPP Team

We are a trio to be reckoned with! Our team isn't restricted to the walls of our work-space or the limitations of our minds; anyone who wants to contribute can do so.


Why Do We Need Your Support?

What better way to break the stereotype regarding Pakistan than for it's youngsters to take a trip across the country, meet the people who are doing incredible work within their domains & share their stories with the world. 

It might be surprising for you to imagine 3 girls doing it, but that's exactly the thought process we need to change!

We have prepared our itinerary & identified people in every city who will host us & take us around their cities.

Our team will curate the entire journey in a video format, shoot the videos of unsung heroes, write blogs and promote everything on digital media for all to see.


What do we need?


The Impact

Your contribution will go a long way:
  • First & foremost, showing the world that Pakistanis are harmonious, peaceful & progressive people
  • Breaking the stereotype that girls in Pakistan are not independent & empowered
  • Conducting extensive on-ground activities across the country to spread the message of optimism far & wide
  • Traveling & reaching out to remote areas to meet the unsung heroes to record their stories
  • Having a roof on our head  (wheels on the road too)
  • Keeping our equipment up-to-date
  • Promoting our message through media far & wide
  • Reaching out to people around the globe and changing the way they see Pakistan
  • Giving the people of Pakistan an avenue to express their successes and achievements
  • Eventually spreading hope, optimism and positivity
Every dollar you contribute will go a long way towards transforming the perspective of a Pakistani and creating more success stories.

Beyond money— we need your help spreading the word

At its heart, MPP is a grassroots movement driven by youngsters and civil society who want to transform the image of Pakistan. Whether you donate to our campaign or not, you can still help a nation in changing its image.

Ways you can help:

  • Share our videos and campaign
  • Spread the word about the MPP movement on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter
  • Recruit a local group to spread the word and gather contributions
  • Volunteer your time and expertise for MPP
  • Stay connected. Follow MPP on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram

story:
For the past several years I had a dream that I run an educational institute where I may serve the new generations coming to this world; help them not only to get literate but also give them an environment where they can get help to grow themselves to become a better human being.

As first phase of this project, we want to start school for children belonging to middle lower class families so that they get a higher quality education with low fees, an excellent environment for learning which everyone deserves.

For this purpose, we want to provide children with all class facilities like tables, chairs board, good quality course books etc. that class needs. Library with books they need. And most importantly excellent teaching staff who likewise feel the urge to collaborate together to provide education and help improve the living quality around them,

The important factor of this venture, the capital amount, is still needed to be addressed. And for the same reason, we have launched this campaign. We have identified a total amount of USD 12,000 of investment which includes capital investment and first 12 months operational cost.

So friends, pool in as much as you can so that we may together help the children of the new generations get equal quality of education and nurture, and contribute to the betterment of the world.

story:
Short Summary

Big Data can only deliver an impact when associated with intelligence that extracts knowledge from it. This is what Machine Learning does by automatically finding patterns in data and using them to make predictions. These predictions can then be integrated in real-world applications and at large scale thanks to predictive APIs (Application Programming Interfaces).

PAPIs '15 is a community conference that brings together experts from all over the world who are defining the future of predictive technology and who are exploiting its opportunities. This year's edition will also be the 1st time ever that leaders at Amazon Machine Learning, Google Prediction API, Microsoft Azure ML and BigML all meet on stage.

The event will be taking place on 6 & 7 August 2015 in Sydney, Australia, but we also want to make it accessible to those who won't be able to travel. For that, we plan to live stream the conference presentations and to edit and publish videos for you to watch them later. We need your help to make this happen!

What We Need & What You Get

Funds will be used to hire operators, equipment, and to cover the costs of filming + streaming + editing. Any extra funds will be reinvested in the conference or in future editions. Here is what we can offer in exchange for your contribution:
  • Exclusive access to the live stream during the conference
  • Exclusive access to the videos of the talks when they have been edited (to watch online or to download and watch offline)
  • Free Data Scientist Kit with credit for predictive APIs and Machine Learning as a Service platforms (worth a few hundred dollars), and copy of Bootstrapping Machine Learning ebook (worth $39)
  • 30' skype call with me, Louis Dorard (General Chair of PAPIs.io), to chat about the conference, predictive technology... anything you'd like!
  • Mention of your name or the name of your company on stage at the opening address
  • Your logo between talks on the live stream and at the beginning of videos

The Impact

You'll help make the conference accessible to a wider audience. Supporting PAPIs also means supporting future editions of the conference (this year is the second edition and we're already planning a new edition for 2016). PAPIs is dedicated to predictive APIs and apps, and community events like this help disseminate and advance technology!

Last year, PAPIs '14 took place in Barcelona and attracted more than 200 developers, data scientists, researchers, business guys and students coming from 22 different countries. Here is what our attendees said about the event:

  • "PAPIs was the best conference I visited in 2014. If you are building predictive applications or publishing APIs for predictive applications, it is a must-visit conference." — Lars Trieloff, Director Product Management at Blue Yonder
  • "It was a great crowd — it really felt like everyone there was excited about the space and where it might go in the next few years. It reminded me of the first PyData I attended a few years ago." — Greg Lamp, CTO at Yhat
  • "I was impressed by the quality and diversity of speakers and attendees. I walked away with valuable knowledge and also made new friends. PAPIs surpassed my expectations and I look forward to the next one." — Rizwan Mallal, VP of Operations at Forum Systems

Risks & Challenges

The main risk we're facing is related to the internet connection. We'll be aiming to use a separate, high-speed wired internet connection, but we won't be able to guarantee 100% that the bandwidth will be high enough at all times. This is also why we'll be editing and publishing videos of the talks after the conference: so that if the stream fails during a talk, you'll still be able to watch that talk when the video is ready.

For that we'll be working with video professionals and you can check out the videos we made last year on YouTube.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to help but can't make a financial contribution to this campaign, you could...
  • Share this page on social networks and use the share tools to help us get the word out
  • Join our team of volunteers and partners, most of whom help us remotely — get in touch if you're interested
  • Join the conversation on twitter at #papis2015 and retweet anything interesting that you see!

Thanks for your help!

Louis
story_txt:
Short Summary Big Data can only deliver an impact when associated with intelligence that extracts knowledge from it. This is what Machine Learning does by automatically finding patterns in data and using them to make predictions. These predictions can then be integrated in real-world applications and at large scale thanks to predictive APIs (Application Programming Interfaces).
PAPIs '15 is a community conference that brings together experts from all over the world who are defining the future of predictive technology and who are exploiting its opportunities. This year's edition will also be the 1st time ever that leaders at Amazon Machine Learning, Google Prediction API, Microsoft Azure ML and BigML all meet on stage.
The event will be taking place on 6 & 7 August 2015 in Sydney, Australia, but we also want to make it accessible to those who won't be able to travel. For that, we plan to live stream the conference presentations and to edit and publish videos for you to watch them later. We need your help to make this happen!   What We Need & What You Get
Funds will be used to hire operators, equipment, and to cover the costs of filming + streaming + editing. Any extra funds will be reinvested in the conference or in future editions. Here is what we can offer in exchange for your contribution:

Exclusive access to the live stream during the conference
Exclusive access to the videos of the talks when they have been edited (to watch online or to download and watch offline)

Free Data Scientist Kit with credit for predictive APIs and Machine Learning as a Service platforms (worth a few hundred dollars), and copy of Bootstrapping Machine Learning ebook (worth $39)

30' skype call with me, Louis Dorard (General Chair of PAPIs.io), to chat about the conference, predictive technology... anything you'd like!
Mention of your name or the name of your company on stage at the opening address
Your logo between talks on the live stream and at the beginning of videos
   The Impact You'll help make the conference accessible to a wider audience. Supporting PAPIs also means supporting future editions of the conference (this year is the second edition and we're already planning a new edition for 2016). PAPIs is dedicated to predictive APIs and apps, and community events like this help disseminate and advance technology!

story:
Short Summary

The Mental Athlete brand is a lifestyle brand for the brain. We aim to develop products which leverage evidence-based strategies to improve cognitive performance. It is about giving people scientifically proven strategies to help them do whatever they want to faster, better and for longer.

This campaign is to give us the resources to produce our first product, Optimem, which is a supplement, designed to improve memory, focus and processing speed. You can read more about the science behind Optimem in our white paper.

Mental Athlete was founded by Daniel Kilov. Daniel was the silver medalist at the 2011 and 2012 Australian Memory Championships. He also broke the Australian record for the abstract images event and is the official holder of that record, having memorized the order of 115 abstract shapes.

Daniel believes that we are all mental athletes; in a competitive world, we all need to be able to remember more, to be more creative, innovative and focused. In this sense, the techniques and strategies used by memory athletes should be available to everyone.

For a summary of the evidence for Optimem, please see our white paper here: http://mentalathlete.com.au/Optimem_whitepaper_...

What We Need & What You Get

• We are asking for $22000 to launch/develop an evidence based cognitive enhancer that we hope will be life changing. All proceeds will be directed towards developing a sustainable range of neurologically active agents that will positively impact the lives of anyone wishing a ‘central processing’ advantage/edge

• A unique combination of nootropics that have been shown, by scientific rigour, to act in a synergistic and complimentary fashion to aid processing speed, memory and cognition

• All funds will be directed towards realising our goal of developing safe, evidence based and affordable cognitive boosting supplements, within reach of almost everyone.


The Impact

We have yet to meet anyone who would not want or benefit from improved cognition or memory.

• This product is available to everyone, not just elite mental athletes. Conversely, it is also not merely for those struggling with neurological deficits. This is a product for everyone, designed to enhance the lives of us all.

• Designed by us and taken by us, this is a product we stand by.

Risks & Challenges

There are a number of challenges involved in bringing our brand to life. Firstly, unless we can raise the full $22000, we will not have enough to cover the manufacturing costs of for our product. The key concern here is that not enough people will hear about our product in time.

In addition, our insistence on using only the highest quality ingredients and independent lab testing means additional lead time from the end of the campaign to getting the product into your hands.

In an effort to overcome these obstacles, we will be sponsoring this year’s Australian Memory Championships. This offers us a unique opportunity to raise awareness of our brand and this campaign. We also hope to leverage the power of social media to spread awareness of this campaign (You can help – see below!)


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't want to purchase Optimem, you can still help with the campaign.

Please share our campaign with friends and family or through social media. You can also take advantage of the Indiegogo share tools!

Please also take the time to follow us on Facebook and Instagram.

story:
To all who viewed and contributed to the ERASE Campaign,

First of all thank you for your support of ERASE, our crowd funding campaign to rapidly deploy the Guardian technology throughout the US. We, like you, believe Guardian technology belongs in every school in America if we are to minimize the damage of school shootings.

To our contributors as you probably know despite your generous contributions we did not reach our goal.  After much discussion, we have decided to refund your contribution.  You should see your refund within two weeks of this posting.  Please be assured that although ERASE was not as successful as we would have wished, we continue working to insert this life saving technology into our schools. 

For those who wish to follow our progress over the next few weeks, months and years you can visit the SDS website at www.shooterdetectionsystems.com where we will periodically post updates.

Again thank you for your interest.

Sincerely,

The ERASE Team

It takes emergency response teams 18 minutes to arrive at the scene of an active shooting event. Yet active shooting events only last 12.5 minutes on average.

"Early Response to Active Shooter Events" (E.R.A.S.E.) aims to raise contributions to fund the installation of lifesaving Guardian technology in the main entrances of 50 schools, one in each of the 50 states. Guardian effectively "erases" emergency response times down from 18 minutes to 2.

Watch our video above, read on below about this amazing technology and contribute what you can towards our $1,000,000 goal.



Photo: Actual drill in Methuen, MA, with an installed Guardian system. Special Response Team arrives at the scene in nearly 2 minutes.


The 18:00 response delay is no one's fault. It's due to lack of information, the inherent chaos of an active shooting event, the inability for someone at the scene to call 911, human uncertainty as to what they just heard, and many other factors.

Guardian technology reduces the emergency response time from 18 minutes to just a few. That saves lives. But it's not just the emergency response teams that get notified. It notifies the school's leadership, administration, and teachers immediately so they know a shot was fired and exactly where it was fired within the school. 

Many schools currently utilize active shooter training programs that teach "Run, Hide, Fight." Guardian's immediate and accurate information initiates these procedures with teachers and school officials much more quickly, saving lives.


How Guardian technology works.

Guardian technology “hears” and “sees” gunshots using sound and infrared technology and notifies law enforcement and school officials immediately and automatically using the Internet. It provides not only a notification, but a graphic of the school’s layout with the shooter’s location pinpointed.

Response time is reduced from 18 minutes to just a few. 


Guardian Indoor Gunshot Detection system incorporates the world’s finest acoustic gunshot detection software and combines it with infrared gunfire flash detector to produce the most capable indoor gunshot detection system available today. The system’s dual modality provides the highest rate of detection while bringing the number of potential false alerts to zero. 

And this is not just a "drawing board" idea or a prototype. We know Guardian works and this campaign will get the technology for these 50 schools at cost.


"Was that a gunshot?"

Guardian removes the human element in judging whether or not a shot was fired. The sensors must see and hear both the IR and acoustic waves to declare a shot alert. To date there has not been a false alarm.


Guardian knows instantly that it was, indeed, a gunshot, which sets the communication in motion to emergency responders and school staff. It's all about "erasing" time.


Over $45 million dollars of research and development has been invested by the US Government and a defense contractor to mature this capability. The technology has saved the lives of countless military men and women overseas.

We have repurposed that military grade technology specifically for a school environment. The Guardian devices are barely visible to teachers and children walking by them in the halls - no more visible than a fire alarm.

Many corporations and public venues have installed the system but only a handful of schools due to budgetary issues. It just takes too long to get this lifesaving technology installed in schools.

That's why we're doing this crowdfunding campaign. Contribute to this campaign and you will help us erase precious response time and save lives.


Your contributions to the “Early Response to Active Shooter Events” campaign, no matter where you are from, will go towards the installation of Guardian Active Shooter Detection Systems in those 50 schools.

If yours is the school district that raises the most funds per pupil in your state (and your state raises more than $20,000 total), then your district will be awarded the prized technology. After that, it will be up to your superintendent to decide which school will get Guardian installed.

If we are successful, one school in every state will be protected with Guardian technology.


Click here for "Find Your District" page.

Though our campaign goal at the top-right of this page says "$20,000" our ambitions are far greater. Indiegogo's rules require that a campaign exceed its stated goal in order to receive the money it raises. So that $20,000 will only cover one school. If that's all we get, we will still be happy to at least protect one school.

$20,000 = 1 school

$1,000,000 = 50 schools

But the maker of Guardian is offering its lifesaving technology at cost (no profit to them) to up to 50 schools if we can raise the money through this campaign. Our real goal, then, is $1,000,000. 

It’s ambitious, but we can do it with your help.


Chris Connors is the CEO of Shooter Detection Systems. Greg Bokor is an artist. 
But Chris and Greg were introduced by a mutual friend, one who knew they had something in common: the belief that active shooting incidents in schools was the issue of our time. The result of that meeting is the "Early Response To Active Shooter Events" (E.R.A.S.E.) crowdfunding campaign.

Chris has agreed to offer up the 50 Guardian systems at cost, meaning zero profit to the company. Mr. Bokor has agreed to recreate his incredibly moving “ERASE” art installation at a gala event following the crowdfunding campaign that many of our contributors will be able to attend via Indiegogo's crowdfunding "perks."



ERASE was a participatory memorial art installation launched in September, 2013 at the ArtPrize festival in Grand Rapids, MI. It started with the hand-drawing of a 20ft long AR-15 rifle and ended with exhibit participants erasing pieces of the rifle. Each eraser was hand-stamped with the name and age of a victim from the Columbine, Virginia Tech, Aurora and Newtown massacres. The recreation of this art installation will provide our crowdfunding campaign with a very powerful and quite relevant emotional experience. Tickets to the event will be available as one of our “perks” on Indiegogo.


Time-lapse video of ERASE:

story:
Let's help High School students find their passions by involving the community in their education.

There are over 600,000 college students in Chicago alone. Many of these students are building skills and understanding in their own field; choosing a major in order to focus their efforts on a passionate career. Why not use the resource of higher education to advance the instruction and success of those in high school? The talented and driven minds of thousands of college students can help raise the achievement of the engaged, the bored, the motivated, and the struggling.

With Advance Chicago, students can absorb subjects that captivate them. Subjects they had no way of experiencing with traditional classroom lessons, especially with today’s standards based curriculum. Advance Chicago helps to create a learning environment that is built by the interests of students and the knowledge of community members.

In order to achieve more with what we have, an effort outside of the system is necessary.


When you were in High School, you were probably given a course schedule, you might have had the chance to pick some electives, and you possibly had a few presenters come to your class.

But what if you were curious about architecture?

Or criminal justice?

Or neuroscience?

Or video game design?

What if you were curious about all of those?

We should be educating children to become innovative achievers, to be leaders of their field, to have their questions heard and responded to. In order to do this, America needs its students to explore new ideas, and we need to push the boundaries of how we think schools and communities should work together. The answer is simple.

We are the resource we most need.


There is no vaccination to issues in education. But Advance Chicago is a part of the solution, and can help lead the movement of the everyday encounters that make young students’ lives better. When reaching students, hope transpires through unquenchable curiosity.

So what exactly will Advance Chicago look like?


Students at local Chicago universities visit the Advance Chicago website and submit an online registration with information about their background in education and what subjects they're passionate about, or are excited and capable of sharing with others. This will develop a database that's tagged with each university student's category of topic to lead lessons at local High Schools.

Meanwhile at a local High School, students have expressed interests to the Advance Chicago facilitator (a teacher at the local High School who helps provide information for the program). Some students say they've always wondered what it's like to produce music, and some wanted to know what being chef is all about.

It just so happens the Advance Chicago database has a music producing major and a culinary arts major who would love to create a 30 or 50 minute lesson on a certain aspect of their craft.

Advance Chicago will then schedule the university students to come in for a 2 day training. Students get help with role playing the act of speaking and fielding questions, and guidance on how to smooth out their lesson plans. The college students then go out to the local High School and lead their lesson, the students, and a movement.

This will happen hundreds of times in many different classrooms throughout schools all across Chicago.



Not only university students, but people pursuing their craft in Chicago will eventually become part of the database, and high school students will have the chance to learn from them regularly. Imagine having a chemist, a librarian, a cellist, a painter, and a writer instructing students who want to know what they have to say. Many professionals have considered a career in teaching. This is their chance to experience that thrill, all while giving back to the community.



The curiosity of students, which is the engine for discovery and innovation, fades when they don’t have a chance to experience the breadth of endeavors available to them. School systems all over the country are moving away from arts and humanities, which might reduce the chance a student will have to explore and create. Advance Chicago is financially sustainable without ongoing grants year after year. It’s formatted to work within individual communities, and to utilize their strengths without inflicting its own agenda.

Advance Chicago can be the step towards advancing America.

We don’t need to wait for federal or state or local reforms to fix the way our children learn. We can do this together. Now.

What's the money actually being raised for?

The goal is to have a pilot semester going in 2-3 schools starting in January 2016 (that’s just a few months away!). The pilot semester will be instrumental in building trust with the community and local schools.  We will be able to learn by doing, and have time to smooth out any kinks before the first full year of Advance Chicago projected to start in the Fall 2016. This is what we need to start that Pilot Semester:

  • A website that can reach hundreds of thousands of college students.

  • Office supplies like a computer with cloud storage, a red stapler, and a phone that’s connected to the land.

  • Promotional materials to bring to schools, universities, and community centers.

  • An awesome incentive program for the university students that lead the lessons.

  • An equally awesome incentive program for young students who attend the lessons at their schools.

  • A plush mascot as yet to be determined (Suggestions?).

  • Meager means for the small but dedicated team that will spend hundreds of hours getting this initiative ready for the pilot and the 2016-2017 school year.

                                                           

                                                                   


Meet the Team

Jim Millar – Founder

Jim has worked and volunteered in education programs within and outside of Chicago for 9 years. During 2012-2013, Jim helped Pilot the University of Chicago research study on gun violence prevention using educational interventions. In the past, he has partnered with local organizations such as: BAM (Becoming a Man), Chicago Freedom School, and Pilsen Neighbors Community Council. His most recent position was teaching Language Arts on the Rosebud Indian Reservation in South Dakota. Jim is looking forward to finally starting Advance Chicago; a concept he came up with six years ago.

Sarah Glazer – Networker

Sarah is a current English teacher for energetic middle schoolers in Chicago. She has helped Advance with planning and organizing, as well as assisting with social networks and school contacts. Sarah is thrilled to be a part of a program designed to help so many kids find their passion.

Ashely Arnold – Design Extraordinaire

Ashley is a freelance Graphic Designer with work in many places throughout Chicago. She has a keen eye towards clean and fun design, and loves being able to work for local community projects. Ashley helps Advance with our promotional work, and is on board to build our website when we reach our goal.

Students at local Chicago universities visit the Advance Chicago website and
submit an online registration with information about their background in
education and what subjects they're passionate about, or are excited and capable
of sharing with others. This will develop a database that's tagged with each university
student's category of topic to lead lessons at local High Schools. 
Meanwhile at a local High School, students have expressed interests to the Advance
Chicago facilitator (a teacher at the local High School who helps provide
information for the program). Some students say they've always wondered what
it's like to produce music, and some wanted to know what being chef is all
about. 
It just so happens the Advance Chicago database has a music producing major
and a culinary arts major who would love to create a 30 or 50 minute lesson on a
certain aspect of their craft. 
Advance Chicago will then schedule the university students to come in for a 2
day training. Students get help with role playing the act of
speaking and fielding questions, and guidance on how to smooth out their lesson
plans. The college students then go out to the local High School and lead their
lesson, the students, and a movement. 
This will happen hundreds of times in many different classrooms throughout schools
all across Chicago. 



Not only university students, but people pursuing their craft in Chicago will eventually 
become part of the database, and high school students will have the chance to learn
from them regularly. Imagine having a chemist, a librarian, a cellist, a
painter, and a writer instructing students who want to know what they have to
say. Many professionals have considered a career in teaching. This is their
chance to experience that thrill, all while giving back to the community. 



The curiosity of students, which is
the engine for discovery and innovation, fades when they don’t have a chance
to experience the breadth of endeavors available to them. School systems all
over the country are moving away from arts and humanities, which might reduce the
chance a student will have to explore and create. Advance Chicago is financially sustainable without ongoing grants year
after year. It’s formatted to work within individual communities, and to
utilize their strengths without inflicting its own agenda. 
Advance Chicago can be the step towards advancing America. 
We don’t need to wait for federal or state or local reforms to fix the way
our children learn. We can do this together. Now.

What's the money actually being
raised for? 
The goal is to have a pilot semester going in 2-3 schools starting in
January 2016 (that’s just a few months away!). The pilot semester will be
instrumental in building trust with the community and local schools.  We will be able to learn by doing, and have time to smooth out any kinks before the first full year of Advance Chicago
projected to start in the Fall 2016. This is what we need
to start that Pilot Semester:

A website that can reach hundreds of thousands
of college students.
Office supplies like a computer with cloud
storage, a red stapler, and a phone that’s connected to the land.
Promotional materials to bring to schools, universities,
and community centers.
An awesome incentive program for the university
students that lead the lessons.
An equally awesome incentive program for young
students who attend the lessons at their schools.
A plush mascot as yet to be determined
(Suggestions?).
Meager means for the small but dedicated team
that will spend hundreds of hours getting this initiative ready for the pilot
and the 2016-2017 school year. 

                                                                                                                               
Meet the Team
Jim Millar – Founder
Jim has worked and volunteered in education programs within
and outside of Chicago for 9 years. During 2012-2013, Jim helped Pilot the
University of Chicago research study on gun violence prevention using educational
interventions. In the past, he has partnered with local organizations such as:
BAM (Becoming a Man), Chicago Freedom School, and Pilsen Neighbors Community Council.
His most recent position was teaching Language Arts on the Rosebud Indian
Reservation in South Dakota. Jim is looking forward to finally starting Advance
Chicago; a concept he came up with six years ago.Sarah Glazer – Networker Sarah is a current English teacher for energetic middle schoolers in Chicago. She has helped Advance with planning and organizing, as well as assisting with social networks and school contacts. Sarah is thrilled to be a part of a program designed to help so many kids find their passion. 
Ashely Arnold – Design Extraordinaire
Ashley is a freelance Graphic Designer with work in many places
throughout Chicago. She has a keen eye towards clean and fun design, and loves
being able to work for local community projects. Ashley helps Advance with our promotional
work, and is on board to build our website when we reach our goal.

story:
Because small business start-ups create the most new jobs.
Because start-ups are innovation driven businesses; they are the ones that bring fresh ideas and products.

Because start-ups are a goldmine for investors as ROI can be astonishing (Twitter anyone?).
Because start-up survival statistics are downright frightening - hardly 50% survive to their fifth year.
Because not everyone is a Bill Gates or Steve Jobs, whose natural talents, charm and drive compensated for the lack of business experience and time proven skills.


With YOUR help and contribution, we can build virtual training grounds for the development of skills necessary for start-uppers. “Give a man a fish; you have fed him for today.  Teach a man to fish; and you have fed him for a lifetime”. To provide start-uppers with facilities to learn how to “fish”- this is our goal.


If we summarize the reasons why start-ups fail, we'll end up with these two reasons: the lack of specific business oriented knowledge and skills.

Skills and knowledge can be attained by using business simulations.

Therefore, we want to create and develop a special company within Virtonomics, that will be:

  • A simulation of a start-up.
  • High tech orientated, players will be developing both new hardware and software.
  • The core and challenges of the game will be based on main reasons why start-ups fail.
  • Integrated into our global virtual economy to supplement it and gain natural feedback.

A start-up company in Virtonomics will allow start-uppers to explore business environment and processes, experiment and learn, by developing their business skills and gaining experience.

After completing the game, there would be less risk in starting and running your real business. And less risk means more chances to fulfill your ideas and dreams.


We are a highly specialized international team of specialists in education and engineering from the ICT sector. We have been creating business simulations for over 7 years. We also believe that actions speak louder than words. Thus below are the results we proudly present, as they describe us best.

Virtonomics, one of our biggest projects, is a strategic online business simulation with a virtual economy that gathers over 1 million players. A virtual economy meant to simulate real economies and business processes.

About Virtonomics:

The purpose of this strategic business game is to start and run your own business.

A real, dynamic virtual economy with over 1,000,000 registered users. All players are a part of our virtual economy. Their decisions and actions directly affect the in-game economy.

International geography:

  • 33 Countries.
  • 300 cities and towns of various sizes.

Variety of available activities within our virtual economy:

  • 24 industries.
  • 203 products to manufacture.
  • 141 types of subsidiaries.

A large variety of natural business processes to become familiar with:

  • Supply - chain management.
  • Purchase management.
  • Marketing.
  • Production management.
  • HR management.
  • Finance management.
  • R&D.
  • Strategic management.
  • Analysis and decision making.
  • Business planning.
  • Infrastructure management.

4 simulations in one game:

  • Business environment.
  • Social environment.
  • Economical environment.
  • Political environment.

In-game purchases include:

  • Create your own Logo - visible to all Suppliers, in contracts and company ratings.  Available in some Perks.
  • Trade Marks. Create a brand name for a product you can manufacture in Virtonomics. You can set a TM for each retail product. Your TM will be displayed in the lists of suppliers and in all contracts.  Available in some Perks.
  • Game-created managers e.g. Head of HR Department, etc.

The game is turned based. There are 3 types of game realms:

  1. Fast server. Turns/updates are made once every hour. New players start their training on this realm.
  2. Standard free servers. Turns are made once every 24 hours. Various in-game purchases are available.
  3. Paid server. Turns are made once every 24 hours. All content is available to the player.
